attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The shadow giant lashes out with his shadow chains at any PC who dares get close to him. If he is somehow disarmed of his melee weapon, the shadow giant draws his rifle or hurls debris ripped from the nearby houses.

Morale Abandoning his task would besmirch the shadow giants reputation, so he fights to the death.

attribs.name: immunities
attribs.current: Ability Damage, Ability Drain, Cold, Negative Levels

attribs.name: feats
attribs.current: Deadly Aim, Improved Combat Manoeuvre (Bull Rush)

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Superior Iridishell, Ecclesiastic Shadow Chains, Tomb-Class Void Rifle with 1 High-Capacity Battery (40 Charges)

attribs.name: organization
attribs.current: Solitary, Gang (2-5), Family (6-13 plus 1 Shadow Giant Mystic and 1 Shadow Giant Soldier), or Company (14-33 plus 1 Shadow Giant Soldier)

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXD7ykc-PUHtYJ-hUR_description
attribs.current: A shadow giant inflicts its energy drain attack no more than once per round via its first successful melee attack or via hurl debris.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXE3wmQO71w99ujoAg_description
attribs.current: The mighty strength of a giant allows it to turn nearly anything into a ranged weapon. A giant is assumed to have such debris available (either loose or readily torn from the environment without requiring an extra action) unless the GM rules otherwise. Hurled debris has a range increment of 40 ft.. Such attacks also create difficult terrain in a 5-foot-radius area around the target, or a 10-foot-radius area for Huge and larger giants.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXXCqsVEXjC3fTtoMEc_description
attribs.current: The mighty strength of a giant allows it to turn nearly anything into a ranged weapon. A giant is assumed to have such debris available (either loose or readily torn from the environment without requiring an extra action) unless the GM rules otherwise. Hurled debris has a range increment of 40 ft.. Such attacks also create difficult terrain in a 5-foot-radius area around the target, or a 10-foot-radius area for Huge and larger giants.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXEZoaZI09soPfImwG_description
attribs.current: As a move action in any illumination other than direct sunlight, a shadow giant can cloak itself in moving shadows that grant it concealment (20% miss chance) for [[1d6+6]] rounds. It can use this ability three times per day.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXD36mtyo2Oy-uFUiy_description
attribs.current: When ending a flying or jumping movement, the shadow giant can land on targets that are at least three size categories smaller than itself. Targets are automatically knocked prone, take the listed damage, and are pinned. Each crushed target can attempt to escape the pin normally on its turn, and the pin ends automatically if it moves out of the targets square. A crushed target does not take damage from the crush more than once, unless the shadow giant moves fully off that creature and then back onto it.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXXCZmj8lpSWU0bWGSu_description
attribs.current: Worshipers of Zon-Kuthon developed the first shadow chains using cutting-edge heat-transfer technology, but outsiders rapidly reverse-engineered the weapons, constructing functional facsimiles from their own tech. Shadow chains links rapidly absorb heat, while their heavily insulated handle protect their wielders from direct exposure to the freezing darkness. Many adherents of the Midnight Lord make use of the follower, acolyte, and penitent shadow chains, while only the most devout can afford the more powerful ecclesiastic and devotional shadow chains.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXXCiovwPOpRra6iHiP_description
attribs.current:
A firearm designed with crystals from the Plane of Shadow, a void rifle is unique in that power flowing through those crystals allows the rifle to fire inky bolts of life-sapping cold. The rifles frigid energy can harm only the living, so it does nothing to constructs and undead. Regardless, the rifle remains a favorite of followers of Urgathoa. Grave- and crypt-class void rifles are an option for standard issue among rank-and-file marines of the Eoxian navy, while tomb-, ossuary-, and barrow-class void rifles are reserved for elite forces.

Antibiological
An antibiological weapon damages only living targets. Objects and creatures with the unliving special quality, such as robots and undead, are immune to its effects.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The kayals use trick attack every round to deal the most damage to their targets. If the PCs seem to be competent melee fighters, two of the kayals pull back to fire their pistols.

Morale If two or more of the kayals are reduced to fewer than half their Hit Points or at least two of the kayals fall, the assassins attempt to retreat into the darkness. These kayals accept defeat and dont harass the PCs any further.

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Operative Exploits (Bleeding Shot, Cloaking Field), Specialization (Ghost)

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: D-Suit II, Red Star Plasma Pistol with 2 Batteries (20 Charges each), Triple Focus Rifle with 1 High-Capacity Battery (40 Charges), Tactical Knife

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXHrRXwk5-2gWEnjBp_description
attribs.current: Attacks against a kayal in dim light have a 50% miss chance instead of the normal 20% miss chance. This ability does not grant total concealment; it just increases the miss chance.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXHFt2Ghn0jsKlwOck_description
attribs.current: When a kayal succeeds at both the skill check and attack roll of their trick attack, they can make the target flat-footed or off-target until the beginning of their next turn. They might learn exploits that grant them additional options for their debilitating trick, but they can select only one option each time they hit with a trick attack.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXHIReMlbU89Qlckrt_description
attribs.current: A kayal can trick or startle a foe and then attack when she drops her guard. As a full action, they can move up to their speed. Whether or not they moved, they can then make an attack with a melee weapon with the operative special property or with any small arm. Just before making their attack, attempt a Bluff, Intimidate, or Stealth check (or a check associated with your specialization; see page 94) with a DC equal to 20 + their targets CR. If they succeed at the check, they deal 4d8 additional damage and the target is flat-footed against their attack. They cant use this ability with a weapon that has the unwieldy special property or that requires a full action to make a single attack.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXXGyIqr08u8TQSnkC-_description
attribs.current: These light blades can be used for both mundane tasks and combat. Tactical knives have large, double-edged blades, often with a section of serrated blade near the haft, and they come in both fixed- and folding-blade designs; users may prefer one style or the other, but the two are identical in terms of price, weight, and damage dealt.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXXH2R-LQnaqcgZCnmj_description
attribs.current: Plasma pistols fire a line of ionized plasma out to a relatively short range. The plasma can continue to burn after contact.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXXHA-OZun6ZQioDDT6_description
attribs.current: This elongated laser rifle contains additional lenses that further focus its output, creating a powerful beam that can punch through many substances at ranges far greater than those of a typical laser rifle. Dual, triple, and quad focus rifles use increasing numbers of focusing lenses, intensifying the laser but compounding the price. A compound focus rifles lenses are specially made of a rare form of glass, creating the most powerful output currently possible for such weapons.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXHNR1wPhmzTEfb7Me_description
attribs.current:
A kayal makes themselfand any clothing, armor, weapons, and equipment on themlook different. They can seem up to 1 foot shorter or taller, thin, fat, or in between. They cant change their creature type (except for humanoids). Otherwise, the extent of the apparent change is up to them. They could merely add or obscure a minor feature, or they could look like an entirely different person or gender.

The spell does not provide the abilities or mannerisms of the chosen form nor does it alter the perceived tactile (touch) or audible (sound) properties of them or their equipment. If they use this spell to create a disguise, they gain a +10 circumstance bonus to the Disguise check (since it counts as altering their form). A creature that interacts with them directly can attempt a Will saving throw to recognize their appearance as an illusion.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The deconstructor tries to grab at a PC with its pneumatic claw to begin the combat. On the second round, it unleashes its shattering cone to catch as many PCs as possible and then returns to using its melee attacks.

Morale The deconstructor fights until it is destroyed.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWtGIYGDnKwoR4Ynrws_description
attribs.current: Any creature that deals damage to the deconstructor with an unarmed strike or melee weapon takes 2d6 electricity damage (Reflex DC 18 half).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWtG79jNUFT3HkM2hEq_description
attribs.current: The deconstructor can emit a cone of sonic energy to break down physical objects once every [[1d4]] rounds. All creatures and objects in the 15-foot cone take 12d6 sonic damage (Fortitude DC 19 half).

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat Each undead mechanic chooses a different PC to attack, focusing its slam attacks on that PC and relying on its decompression gaze to affect that PC and any others who dare to get too close.

Morale The undead mechanics fight until they are destroyed.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWtHg8TYEOmIBYUQ3gt_description
attribs.current: The dead stare of a nihili makes those around the undead feel like their own lungs are starting to violently collapse, mimicking the nihilis demise. A living creature that can see and breathe that begins its turn within 15 feet of a nihili must succeed at a DC 15 Fortitude save or take 1d4+3 bludgeoning damage.

attribs.name: pilot_bonus
attribs.current: @{Corrupted Repair Bot|whisper_state}&{template:sf_generic} {{name=@{character_name}}} {{characterid=@{character_id}}} {{title=^{pilot}}} {{r1=[[1d20+@{|piloting_ranks}[RNK]+[[({0,@{|piloting_ranks}}>1) * @{|piloting_class_skill}]][CS]+@{|piloting_ability}[ABI]+2-2@{|piloting_misc}@{Corrupted Repair Bot|engines_status}@{Corrupted Repair Bot|power_core_status}@{Corrupted Repair Bot|computer_query}?{HELM PHASE INITIATIVE|NO, |YES,&{tracker}}]]}} {{r1name=}}

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat Each robot moves toward the nearest PC and attacks with its sturdy appendages.

Morale The robots fight until they are destroyed.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat Herembour remains near the ceiling, approximately 20 feet from the ground, and fires his nail gun from the shadows for several rounds. On the fourth round, he lands near the PC who has taken the most damage and asks them to join him in suffering. He activates his velstrac rejuvenation after taking a critical hit or being reduced to fewer than 100 Hit Points, whichever comes first.

Morale Driven insane by his corruption, Herembour fights to the death and dies with a smile on his face.

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Shadow Blending, Shadow Manifestations (Painful Clarity, Pain Refuge, Velstrac Durability, Velstrac Rejuvenation)

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Estex Suit III, Carbon Drill (Functions as a Ripper Spined Blade) with 1 Battery (20 Charges), Nail Gun (Functions as an Elite Semi-Auto Pistol) with 20 Nails

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWtejBN9wCQAckyFx08_description
attribs.current: Kasathas on their home world wielded spined blades to better poison foes. Replicas of these ancient weapons can be found in the Museum of Ancestral Technology on the Idari. Modern warriors use refined versions of the weapon that are effective at delivering poisons and similar substances through contemporary armour. You apply such substances to the blade per rules found on page 232 of the Core Rulebook. While the basic version of the spined blade is generally analogue, more advanced buzzblade, ripper, gravity, and rivener models are powered weapons.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWteplBp5-ENVvAVNAX_description
attribs.current: The semiautomatic mechanism of this pistol discharges spent Cartridges and reloads fresh ones in the barrel, provided a cartridge remains in the magazine.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MqZZsWl5EZkuI7X1LEe_description
attribs.current:
Pain clears Herembour's mind.
Prerequisites: Pain Refuge.
Gift: As a reaction when Herembour fails a saving throw against a mind-affecting effect, he can use a weapon he's wielding to deal himself 4 damage, subtracted directly from his Hit Points. If Herembour does so, he can reroll the saving throw. This benefit has no effect if Herembour reduces the damage he inflicts on himself by any amount.
Stain: Herembour thrives on pain, and thus he always has a number of self-inflicted wounds. Reduce Herembour's maximum Hit Points by a number equal to half his level.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MqZZY64nQhV-An0MlHO_description
attribs.current:
The lines between pleasure and pain are blurred for Herembour.
Gift: The first time Herembour takes Hit Point damage in a given combat, for 1 round he can roll attack rolls, saving throws, and skill checks twice and take the better result. Herembour can do so again the first time he drops below half his Hit Points in a given combat. During this time, however, Herembour cant benefit from morale bonuses.
Stain: Increase any damage Herembour takes by an amount equal to the number of manifestations he has, up to a maximum of double the original amount of damage.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MqZaXYskxnx-Sun8Lp5_description
attribs.current:
Herembour exists in a state between mortal and velstrac, placing him at risk of becoming a velstrac when he dies.
Prerequisites: Pain Refuge, Painful Clarity, Velstrac Durability.
Gift: Twice per day, Herembour can grant himself fast healing 3 for 1 minute. Herembour's fast healing functions only while he has 1 Hit Point or more.
Stain: Whenever Herembour gains the dying condition, he loses 1 Resolve Point. In addition, it costs Herembour 1 extra Resolve Point (maximum of 4 instead of 3) to stabilize himself. If Herembour die, he has a [[1d100]]% (50%) chance to reincarnate as an NPC velstrac (an outsider) on the Shadow Plane. If Herembour does, he can be raised from the dead only via miracle or wish along with a soul beacon as if casting raise dead on an undead target.

attribs.name: pilot_bonus

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MX3RthtdFf3W0fpqSMs_description
attribs.current:
Speed 12

Limited Fire
A weapon with this special property can fire only the listed number of times in a starship combat encounter before it requires a brief period of time (10 minutes outside of starship combat) to recharge and rebuild the weapons inherent ammunition. A weapon with this special property is often a tracking weapon.

Some velstrac starships are armed with hybrid torpedo launchers that can cause terror and havoc on enemy ships. A summoning torpedo launcher is a heavy tracking weapon with long range, a speed of 12 hexes, and the limited fire 5 special property. Once per starship combat, when a summoning torpedo deals Hull Point damage to an enemy vessel, it can be triggered to call forth a corporeal horror on board that vessel that plays on its crews fears (see page 14). This weapon is available only for velstrac starships.

attribs.name: repeating_system_-MX3SZR85vgxx7s2WAuo_description
attribs.current: Common crew quarters are the most basic type. They consist of simple bunks (sometimes folding out from the side of a hallway) or other similarly austere places to rest. Crew members who sleep in common quarters usually keep their personal possessions in a footlocker. Common crew quarters also include a communal bathroom (which includes a military-style shower) and a tiny galley (big enough to prepare only the most basic of meals). Starships with crews numbering in the dozens or hundreds often have massive barracks where crew members sleep in shifts.

attribs.name: repeating_system_-MX3ShhwZ-vjDWTcINQR_description
attribs.current: An arcane laboratory contains all the tools and space necessary to craft magic items (see page 235), though the crafter must still provide the necessary raw materials. Such a laboratory reduces the crafting time by half.

attribs.name: repeating_system_-MX3SkdZ8YQ2fZ6mBXPT_description
attribs.current: A brig contains all the necessary restraints and security systems to incarcerate up to eight Medium creatures.

attribs.name: repeating_system_-MX3SmLmqaHtYKLmwwbG_description
attribs.current: A science lab contains scientific apparatuses and other laboratory equipment to aid in the research of certain topics. A life science lab provides a +2 circumstance bonus to Life Science checks.

attribs.name: repeating_system_-MX3Sq07tXOG2CL29IFn_description
attribs.current: A tech workshop contains all the space and tools necessary to craft technological items (see page 235), though the crafter must still provide the necessary raw materials. Such a workshop reduces the crafting time by half.

attribs.name: repeating_system_-MX3SoIouQ4MYhHlPx8h_description
attribs.current: A medical bay functions as a medical lab (see page 220).

attribs.name: captain
attribs.current: Bluff +17 (9 ranks), Computers +14 (9 ranks), Engineering +14 (9 ranks), gunnery +13, Intimidate +17 (9 ranks), Piloting +14 (9 ranks)

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
Before Combat The summoned horror creeps through the corridors of the PCs starship and attempts to ambush a lone PC who strays from the rest of the party.

During Combat The summoned horror is a straightforward combatant, tearing into a single opponent with its claws and fangs. It growls detailed threats of the terrible violence it intends to inflict upon the PCs, though its mouth moves strangely when it does so, as if it is unused to speaking aloud.

Morale The summoned horror fights until it is destroyed, whereupon it dissolves into a cloud of thick black smoke. The cloud lingers for a moment before being sucked into the ships ventilation systems.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat Two draelik idolaters begin combat by using their touch of autocannibalism ability on two of the closest PCs. They follow that up with fatigue and melee attacks. The other two draelik idolaters move a short distance away and cast wisp ally, followed by using the ranged capabilities of their shadowstaves to shoot any obvious spellcasters.

Morale The draelik idolaters fight to the death.

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Advanced Lashunta Tempweave, Shadowstaff with 1 Clip (40 Charges)

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXDsBdGKGwUROHtSNiz_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, a draelik idolater can attempt to touch a single target (making a melee attack against the targets EAC). A struck target must attempt a DC 18 Will saving throw. If successful, the target is staggered for 1 round as it is briefly wracked with pangs of hunger. If unsuccessful, the target is overcome with a compulsion to eat its own flesh, causing it to be staggered for 8 rounds. Each round, the target can bite its own exposed flesh as a standard action, dealing an amount of piercing damage to itself equal to 1d6 + its Strength modifier. If it does so, the target loses the staggered condition. However, if it doesnt continue to chew at its own flesh (and the duration of the effect hasnt ended), it gains the staggered condition again at the beginning of its next turn.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXDsBdGKGwUROHtSNiz_effect
attribs.current: Target must continue to bite its own flesh as a standard action dealing 1d6 + it Strength modifier piercing damage or be staggered.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXDrsU0czawMmHvl4-W_description
attribs.current: A shadowstaff is covered with fell symbols and is often surrounded by a dark nimbus of shadowy energy. As a basic two-handed melee weapon, a shadowstaff deals 2d6 bludgeoning, slashing, or piercing damage (your choice) as it manifests blades or spikes at will, and it has the block weapon special property. When a shadowstaff is used as a small arm, it has a range increment of 60 feet, and a single shot consumes 2 charges from its 40-charge capacity and deals 2d4 cold damage. Switching a shadowstaff from melee functionality to ranged functionality (or vice versa) is a swift action. Additionally, you can use a shadowstaff to create darkness, as per the universal creature rule, once per day (see page 153).

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXDs5suksCUWZrtvkJF_description
attribs.current: A shadowstaff is covered with fell symbols and is often surrounded by a dark nimbus of shadowy energy. As a basic two-handed melee weapon, a shadowstaff deals 2d6 bludgeoning, slashing, or piercing damage (your choice) as it manifests blades or spikes at will, and it has the block weapon special property. When a shadowstaff is used as a small arm, it has a range increment of 60 feet, and a single shot consumes 2 charges from its 40-charge capacity and deals 2d4 cold damage. Switching a shadowstaff from melee functionality to ranged functionality (or vice versa) is a swift action. Additionally, you can use a shadowstaff to create darkness, as per the universal creature rule, once per day (see page 153).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXDsFtjzItWeZ4K296h_description
attribs.current:
The draelik idolator draws forth otherworldly energy to create a small, spherical, floating wisp that can distract its enemies in combat. This wisp can move 60 feet per round in any direction, and it can direct it as a move action on its turn. If the wisp occupies the same space as an enemy, the wisp provides its choice of either harrying fire or covering fire (see pages 246247) against the enemy each round on its turn, and it follows that enemy within range automatically unless it directs it to change targets. The wisp is made of pure light and energy and cant be damaged in combat, though it can be dispelled as normal.

In addition to the function described above, the wisp sheds light in a 20-foot radius in a colour of its choice (chosen when it casts the spell).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXDsL0kPcT0l5VDWRGh_description
attribs.current: The draelik idolator makes a melee attack against a single targets EAC, adding its key ability score modifier to the attack roll instead of its Strength modifier if it is higher. The target must succeed at a Fortitude save or be fatigued for the spells duration. This spell has no effect on a creature that is already fatigued. Casting this spell doesnt provoke attacks of opportunity.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXDsNDLfcALIxARoMGH_description
attribs.current:
The draelik idolator creates a volume of sound that rises, falls, recedes, approaches, or remains fixed. It chooses what type of sound this spell creates when casting it and cannot thereafter change the sounds basic character.

The volume of sound created can produce as much noise as 20 normal humans. Thus, it can create shouting, singing, talking, marching, running, or walking sounds, as well as sounds of battle or small explosions. It can make noises that sound like machines, the general chatter of distant conversation, or the roar of an alien predator, but it cant make specific sounds such as intelligible speech or the exact hum of a particular starships engines.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The Eclipse operatives move about the battlefield, using trick attack each round to deal the most damage. The operatives arent afraid to end their movement adjacent to PCs who appear to fight mainly with ranged weapons, but they try to stay away from melee combatants.

Morale With no real way to return to the Material Plane, the Eclipse operatives fight to the death.

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Advanced Lashunta Tempweave (Haste Circuit), Red Star Plasma Pistol with 2 Batteries (20 Charges each), Tactical Knife

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXHjCZUom56W3GRLVdA_description
attribs.current: When the eclipse operative succeed at both the skill check and attack roll of their trick attack, they can make the target flat-footed or off-target until the beginning of their next turn. They might learn exploits that grant them additional options for their debilitating trick, but they can select only one option each time they hit with a trick attack.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXHjG7DYdRSpssJA-CZ_description
attribs.current: The eclipse operative can trick or startle a foe and then attack when she drops her guard. As a full action, they can move up to their speed. Whether or not they moved, they can then make an attack with a melee weapon with the operative special property or with any small arm. Just before making their attack, attempt an Acrobatics, Bluff, Intimidate, or Stealth check with a DC equal to 20 + their targets CR. If they succeed at the check, they deal 5d8 additional damage and the target is flat-footed against their attack. They cant use this ability with a weapon that has the unwieldy special property or that requires a full action to make a single attack.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXHjIyEHl0E2Hd4s9v8_description
attribs.current: When making a full attack using only melee weapons with the operative special property or small arms, the eclipse operative can make up to three attacks instead of two.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXHiZMMbHFENA4IwTBD_description
attribs.current: These light blades can be used for both mundane tasks and combat. Tactical knives have large, double-edged blades, often with a section of serrated blade near the haft, and they come in both fixed- and folding-blade designs; users may prefer one style or the other, but the two are identical in terms of price, weight, and damage dealt.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXHj4Zlh0yUEtR3Y32b_description
attribs.current: Plasma pistols fire a line of ionized plasma out to a relatively short range. The plasma can continue to burn after contact.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat Komarta takes flight above combat and relies on spells such as bestow curse and mind thrust to hamper the PCs. She regularly spends Resolve Points to use her share pain ability when shot by any of the PCs. If it seems like the PCs are constantly resisting her spells, she turns to using her pistol while remaining in the air.

Morale Hoping that pleasing Dr Gragant will secure her release from the Heartgate, Komarta fights to the death.

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: White Carbon Carbon Skin, Elite Semi-Auto Pistol with 40 Small Arm Rounds, Ultrathin Duelling Sword, Mk 3 Ring of Resistance

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXHnNEoZo8XvPJ3iwhl_description
attribs.current: While duelling swords are crafted to be aesthetically pleasing and are often seen as a mark of rank or tradition, many warriors still train with them to deadly effect.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXHnSbkHWNRElqBzcaU_description
attribs.current: The semiautomatic mechanism of this pistol discharges spent cartridges and reloads fresh ones in the barrel, provided a cartridge remains in the magazine.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXHnf1yQrkSjvZ-GiL1_description
attribs.current: Komarta links her mind to that of a touched creature to swiftly communicate a large amount of complex information in an instant. She decides what the target learns, limited to any amount of information that otherwise could be communicated in 10 minutes. This information comes in a series of visual images and emotional sensations, and it isnt language dependent.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXHnh-3vZZyav-IyOhy_description
attribs.current:
Komarta forges a telepathic bond between herself and a number of willing creatures, each of which must have an Intelligence score of 3 or higher (or a modifier of 4 or higher). Each creature included in the link is linked to all the others. The creatures can communicate telepathically through the bond regardless of language. No special power or influence is established as a result of the bond. Once the bond is formed, it works over any distance (although not from one plane to another).

If desired, she can leave yourself out of the telepathic bond forged. This decision must be made at the time of casting.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MXHnovTig60SqDKKqdl_description
attribs.current: Komarta shoots a black ray at a target, making a ranged attack against the targets EAC. If she hits, the target gains 2 temporary negative levels. Negative levels stack. If the target survives, it recovers from negative levels after a number of hours equal to her caster level (maximum 15 hours). An undead creature struck by the ray gains 10 temporary Hit Points for 1 hour.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MXHnrK8aL6dCkYvZ0e4_description
attribs.current: Komarta divines the most vulnerable portion of her opponents mind and overload it with a glut of psychic information. The target can attempt a Will saving throw to halve the damage dealt by this spell. This spell has no effect on creatures without an Intelligence score.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MXHnx8-GL1OV8JOVirv_effect
attribs.current: Target either: takes -4 penalty to ability checks, attack rolls, saving throws, and skill checks; or has a 50% chance to take no action.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MXHnx8-GL1OV8JOVirv_description
attribs.current:
Komarta places a terrible curse on the target, stealing either its overall competency or its ability to think and act on its feet. Choose one of the following.
The target takes a 4 penalty to ability checks, attack rolls, saving throws, and skill checks.
Each turn, the target has a 50% chance to act normally; otherwise, it takes no action.
She  can also invent her own curse (see Afflictions on page 414 for a few ideas), but it should be no more powerful than those described above. The curse bestowed by this spell cannot be dispelled, but it can be removed with a break enchantment, miracle, remove affliction, or wish spell.

Casting this spell doesnt provoke attacks of opportunity. Bestow curse counters remove affliction.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MXHo-jdfx8xLPKBR1wg_target
attribs.current: One Creature, Object, Spell, or Spellcaster

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MXHo-jdfx8xLPKBR1wg_description
attribs.current:
Komarta can use dispel magic to end one ongoing spell that has been cast on a creature or object, to temporarily suppress the magical abilities of a magic item, or to counter another spellcasters spell. A dispelled spell ends as if its duration had expired. Some spells, as detailed in their descriptions, cant be defeated by dispel magic. Dispel magic can dispel (but not counter) spell-like abilities just as it does spells. The effect of a spell with an instantaneous duration cant be dispelled.

She chooses to use dispel magic in one of two ways: as a targeted dispel or as a counter.

Targeted Dispel: One creature, object, or spell is the target of the dispel magic spell. Komarta can also use a targeted dispel to specifically end one spell affecting the target or one spell affecting an area (such as zone of truth). She must name the specific spell effect to be targeted in this way or otherwise uniquely identify it (such as that burning wall or the spell thats giving him those duplicates). Attempt a dispel check (1d20 + her caster level) with a DC equal to 11 + the spells caster level. If she succeeds, the spell ends. If she doesnt specify a spell and there is more than one possible spell on the target, her targeted dispel attempts to dispel a spell at random.

If she targets a force, an object, or a creature that is the effect of an ongoing spell (such as unseen servant), she attempts a dispel check to end the spell that conjured the object or creature.

If the object that she targets is a magic item, she attempts a dispel check against the item level (DC = 11 + the item level). If she succeeds, all the items magical properties are suppressed for 1d4 rounds, after which the item recovers its magical properties. A suppressed item becomes nonmagical for the duration of the effect. A magic items nonmagical physical properties are unchanged: a suppressed holy laser pistol is still a laser pistol. Artefacts and deities are unaffected by mortal magic such as this.

She can choose to automatically succeed at her dispel check against any spell she has cast.

Counter: Komarta can use the energy of dispel magic to disrupt the casting of other spells. First, select an opponent and take the ready action (see page 249) to cast dispel magic when that target casts a spell. This is considered a purely defensive action. When that readied action is triggered, she casts dispel magic and must attempt a dispel check (1d20 + your caster level) to counter the other spellcasters spell. The DC is equal to 11 + the other spellcasters caster level. If the check is successful and the target is in range, the spell fails and has no result.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MXHo2W12D-ZBSRoXJKS_description
attribs.current: An affected creature moves and attacks at a drastically slowed rate. Creatures affected by this spell are staggered (see page 277). A slowed creature moves at half its normal speed (round down to the next 5-foot increment). Multiple slow effects dont stack. Slow counters and negates haste.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MXHo2W12D-ZBSRoXJKS_target
attribs.current: Up to 11 Creatures, No Two of Which Can Be More than 30 ft. Apart

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MXHo2W12D-ZBSRoXJKS_effect
attribs.current: Target is staggered and moves at half speed.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MXHo5PuXGsFuruZM4kx_description
attribs.current: Komarta stuns all creatures in range for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MXHoE11oDRkmNHWDtwf_description
attribs.current: The target becomes paralyzed and freezes in place. It is aware and breathes normally but cant take any physical actions, even speech. A held creature cant cast spells. Each round on its turn, the target can spend a full action to attempt a new saving throw to end the effect. This does not provoke attacks of opportunity. A winged creature that is paralyzed cant flap its wings and falls. A swimmer cant swim and may drown.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MXHoHQAoF03-Mf-gXR1_effect
attribs.current: Target takes -2 penalty to ability checks, attack rolls, and skill checks for the duration of the spell.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MXHoHQAoF03-Mf-gXR1_save_effect
attribs.current: Target takes -2 penalty to ability checks, attack rolls, and skill checks for the duration of 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MXHoHQAoF03-Mf-gXR1_description
attribs.current: Komarta telepathically racks the targets mind and body with agonizing pain that imposes a 2 penalty to ability checks, attack rolls, and skill checks. A target that succeeds at a Will saving throw reduces the duration to 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXHnZVFJDlnjT1NN8NW_description
attribs.current: Whenever a foe succeeds at a Will save against one of Komarta's spells and completely negates the effect, that foe takes 11 nonlethal damage. This is a mind-affecting pain effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXHnaLzWlSPA379I2VN_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, Komarta can tweak the pain centres in the brain of a foe within 60 feet, causing it to suffer intense agony. The target must succeed at a Will save or be nauseated for 1 round. Regardless of the save, the creature becomes immune to this ability for 24 hours. This is a mind-affecting pain effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXI-pm3q9ZJrM2JYpSZ_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, Komarta can spend 1 Resolve Point to create uncertainty in the mind of a foe within 30 feet. She chooses whether the target becomes flat-footed, becomes off-target, takes a 2 penalty to saving throws, or takes a 2 penalty to skill checks. The effect lasts for a number of rounds equal to half her mystic level, unless the target succeeds at a Will save to reduce the duration to just 1 round. A creature can be affected only by one sow doubt effect. If she uses this ability on the same creature again, the new effect replaces the old effect. This is a mind-affecting effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXI-pm3q9ZJrM2JYpSZ_effect
attribs.current: Target becomes flat-footed, becomes off-target, takes a 2 penalty to saving throws, or takes a 2 penalty to skill checks for 5 rounds.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXI-pm3q9ZJrM2JYpSZ_save_effect
attribs.current: Target becomes flat-footed, becomes off-target, takes a 2 penalty to saving throws, or takes a 2 penalty to skill checks for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXN9X-FzOnFHHjiXThW_special
attribs.current: Explode (20 ft., 2d10 So plus Deafened 1d4 Minutes, DC 18)

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Artificial Intelligence (Exocortex), Expert Rig, Mechanic Trick (Energy Shield [20 HP], 8 Minutes), Miracle Worker (1/Day), Remote Hack (DC 26), Void Flyer, Wireless Hack

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNAUG9C-kIsPgq3kpc_description
attribs.current: Zunar can go 1 hour without breathing and can exist in a vacuum without suffering the associated environmental effects. By spending 1 Resolve Point, he can extend this duration to 8 hours, or he can double that by spending 2 Resolve Points. When in a vacuum, he automatically grows wings made from pure energy that grant him a supernatural fly speed of 120 feet (average manoeuvrability) but that work only in a vacuum.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXN9Kmi-8OskBTbXh2y_description
attribs.current: While duelling swords are crafted to be aesthetically pleasing and are often seen as a mark of rank or tradition, many warriors still train with them to deadly effect. The powered blades of both buzzblade and ripper duelling swords bring this danger into the modern era.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXN9Q9VxFCNUgRZsRfb_description
attribs.current:
With its snub, squared barrel and internal reinforcements, a laser rifle is sturdy and dependable.

Laser Weapons
Laser weapons emit highly focused beams of light that deal fire damage. These beams can pass through glass and other transparent physical barriers, dealing damage to such barriers as they pass through. Barriers of energy or magical force block lasers. Invisible creatures dont take damage from lasers, as the beams pass through them harmlessly. Fog, smoke, and other clouds provide both cover and concealment from laser attacks. Lasers can penetrate darkness, but they dont provide any illumination.

Laser weapons use various means to concentrate beams of light into deadly intensity. Some focus light through a faceted crystal, while others focus the beam through a chemical cloud or ionized gas.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXN9X-FzOnFHHjiXThW_description
attribs.current:
When detonated, a screamer grenade releases a piercing shriek of sonic energy.

Explode (2d10 So, deafened 1d4 minutes, 20 ft.)
Explosives have the Explode special property, which lists the amount of damage the explosion deals, the damage type, special effects (with a duration, if necessary), and the radius of the explosion. When Zunar Attacks with this type of weapon or ammunition, aim at a grid intersection. Each Creature within the blast radius takes the listed damage but can attempt a Reflex saving throw for half damage. If he scores a critical hit, it applies only to the Creature closest to the targeted intersection (he chooses the Creature if several are equally close). If the Explode special property has any special effects other than damage, they are negated with a successful saving throw. Some exploding Weapons, such as smoke Grenades, don't deal damage, so they don't include the damage and damage type entries.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNA-chSbaYsOxmlYHA_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, Zunar can cause a short in an electronic device, including most ranged energy weapons, melee weapons with the powered special property, or a single armour upgrade. This makes the device nonfunctional for 1 round. Overload doesnt cause a locked door, safe, or other device to open, but it prevents anyone from opening it for 1 round. He must be adjacent to the device to use this ability. He can instead use this ability on any electronic device within range of his exocortexs wireless hack. If he uses overload on an item or armour upgrade in someones possession, the owner can attempt a Reflex saving throw to negate the effect (DC = 18). Overload doesnt affect androids, cybernetics, drones, powered armour, robots, or creatures with the technological subtype (all of which have shielding against this sort of attack), or items larger than Medium. Once a device has been successfully overloaded, a residual static charge prevents that device from being overloaded again for 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXN9yQmuTjumkxQ9peH_description
attribs.current: Zunar's exocortex provides him with enhanced combat ability, granting him proficiency with heavy armour and longarms. As a move action during combat, he can designate a foe for his exocortex to track. As long as that target is in sight, the exocortex feeds him telemetry, vulnerabilities, and combat tactics, allowing him to make attacks against that target as if his base attack bonus from his mechanic levels were equal to his mechanic level. Designating another target causes him to immediately lose this bonus against the previous target.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
C1. Storage Shed
During Combat The vespers hound begins by using its prison of chains ability against the clumsiest-looking PC, preferably an envoy or spellcaster. It then uses its slip through the shadows ability to engage a character in melee combat from an unexpected direction.

Morale Knowing it cant leave the shed on its own, the vespers hound fights to the death.

C9. Mining Tunnels
During Combat The vespers hounds use their slip through the shadows ability to appear amid the PCs and begin attacking with their claws, usually making full attacks unless a particular PC is difficult to hit. In such a case, a vespers hound targets that PC with its prison of chains ability.

Morale The vespers hound fight until they are killed.

C10. End Transmission
During Combat The vespers hounds leave the pool by using their slip through the shadows ability. Each attacks a different PC, hoping to keep them in one place to allow Dr Gragant to use her spell-like abilities unhindered.

Morale These beasts are the most loyal to Dr Gragants cause and fight to the death.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXZ620gcoQkKPAMR6f_description
attribs.current: A vespers hound has no discernible facial features. It is immune to sense-dependent effects, as well as effects that target standard senses, such as gaze attacks.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXZoTK3OVn2kgOzf9I_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, a vespers hound can attempt to trap a single creature within 30 feet by lashing out with the length of chain that makes up its spine. The target must succeed at a DC 19 Reflex saving throw or become entangled and knocked prone. At the beginning of each round the target is entangled, the chains try to strangle the target, dealing 2d8 bludgeoning damage. A trapped victim can attempt a DC 30 Acrobatics check to end the entangled condition. Alternatively, an adjacent ally can pull the chains off he victim with a full action that requires no check. The vespers hound cant move more than 30 feet from a target it entangles in this way until the trapped victim escapes or is set free, or until the vespers hound releases the victim as a move action.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXZoTK3OVn2kgOzf9I_effect
attribs.current: Target becomes Entangled and Knocked Prone.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXZhLl4CfjyjGX7uUz_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, a vespers hound can travel between shadows, as dimension door. The vespers hound must begin and end this movement in areas of dim light or darker, and it cannot bring any other creatures with it. It can jump a total of 100 feet per day; this amount can be split among many jumps, but each jump less than 10 feet counts as a 10-foot jump for the purpose of this total.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
C3. Tunnel Entrance
During Combat The shodrav maintains its superior position above the tunnel entrance for as long as it can, striking out with its shadow tendril at any PC it can target.

Morale The shodrav attempts to flee when it is reduced to fewer than 30 Hit Points, jumping into the Material Plane. Depending on how long the PCs remain on the shadow asteroid, it might return later to attack them again.

C8. Ventilation Shaft
During Combat The shodravs begin by striking with their shadow tendrils while moving within reach of the PCs. Each shodrav attacks a different PC.

Morale The shodravs fight hungrily until one is killed or both are reduced to fewer than 25 Hit Points. In either case, any surviving shodrav flees to the Material Plane using shadow jaunt.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXUoSZz6lUueW-61dS_description
attribs.current: A shodrav can see from the Shadow Plane into any coterminous plane, and vice versa.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXUaDcPpmHgjj7Vv-8_description
attribs.current: A shodrav can move from the Shadow Plane to any coterminous plane, and vice versa, using 10 feet of movement.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXVcUpseZMyAF3MCZo_description
attribs.current: A shodravs shadow tendril targets EAC.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXXULVjYPC-MW5yhjbl_description
attribs.current: A shodravs shadow tendril targets EAC.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXUcE4Rhra-ExdBN8g_description
attribs.current: A shodrav that can act during a surprise round can take its full round of actions.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXUYZJ0tp95KQcG94M_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, the shodrav can create a 20-foot-radius area of darkness centred on itself, which negates the effects of all nonmagical light sources in that area. This darkness lasts for a number of minutes equal to the its CR, and it can dismiss the effect as a standard action. The darkness doesnt move with the creature. Unless otherwise noted, any magic source of light can increase the light level in the area as normal.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat Being made out of the same shadowstuff, the Patient is partially connected to the medical device traps. It attempts to reposition PCs into the proximity of these traps to trigger them while avoiding the traps itself.

Morale The Patient fights until it is destroyed.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNFKvY9VZQN4SHsO0H_description
attribs.current: If the Patient hits with its slam attack, it deals normal damage, but if the attack roll successfully hits the targets KAC + 4, the creature also automatically repositions the target as a free action. The Patient can move the target an additional 5 feet for every 5 by which its attack roll exceeds the targets KAC + 4, but the target must remain within the Patients reach.

attribs.name: abilities_menu
tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The mementor casts haste on itself in the first round of combat. It then attempts to keep the table between itself and the PCs in order to use more of its spell-like abilities, especially greater synaptic pulse and mind thrust. If forced into melee combat, the mementor isnt afraid to use its claws.

Morale When reduced to 40 Hit Points or fewer, the mementor attempts to flee to area C8, where it then fights alongside the creatures there. It leaves its book behind.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXMxTwxKU1jv8LPBQm_description
attribs.current: A creature that takes damage from a mementors claws must succeed at a DC 21 Will save or suffer memory loss that takes the form of a cumulative 1 penalty to Intelligence-, Wisdom-, and Charisma-based ability checks and skill checks, as well as to the DCs of spells and special abilities based on those ability scores. If this penalty ever reduces a spellcasters key ability score modifier to +0 or lower, the spellcaster can no longer cast their highest level of spells. When the penalty reduces a creatures ability modifier in any affected ability score to 5, the creature is immediately affected as if by the feeblemind spell. A creature that doesnt arrive at the feeblemind stage can recover from the penalty as if each 1 increment were a temporary negative level. The restoration spell works on each 1 increment as if it were a permanent negative level, but psychic surgery can cure the entire penalty at once. Mindless creatures are immune to this effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXMxTwxKU1jv8LPBQm_effect
attribs.current: Take -1 penalty to mental ability score modifier.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXLEzayoDqGHNTS4TD_description
attribs.current:
The mementor reaches into the targets mind and modify up to 5 minutes of its memories in one of the following ways.
Eliminate all memory of an event the target actually experienced. This spell cannot negate charm person, suggestion, or similar spells.
Allow the target to recall with perfect clarity an event it actually experienced.
Change the details of an event the target actually experienced.
Implant a memory of an event the target never experienced.
Casting the spell takes 1 round. If the target fails its saving throw, Ylenka proceeds with the spell by spending as much as 5 minutes (a period of time equal to the amount of memory it wants to modify) visualizing the memory it wishes to modify in the target. If its concentration is disturbed before the visualization is complete, or if the target moves beyond the spells range at any point during this time, the spell fails.

A modified memory does not necessarily affect the targets actions, particularly if it contradicts the creatures natural inclinations. An illogical modified memory is usually dismissed as a bad dream, a hallucination, or another similar excuse.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXM7cXrkU3t5mdHB7N_description
attribs.current: The mementor divines the most vulnerable portion of its opponents mind and overload it with a glut of psychic information. The target can attempt a Will saving throw to halve the damage dealt by this spell. This spell has no effect on creatures without an Intelligence score.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXLvw6JXp3tIxLUdCc_description
attribs.current:
The targeted creatures move and act more quickly than normal. This extra speed has several effects.

When making a full attack, a hasted creature can also take a separate move action in order to move. The movement can occur before, after, or between the attacks from the full attack. All movement must occur at the same time.

All of the hasted creatures modes of movement (including base, burrow, climb, fly, and swim speeds) increase by 30 feet, to a maximum of twice the targets normal speed using that form of movement. This increase counts as an enhancement bonus, and it affects the creatures jumping distance as normal for increased speed. Multiple haste effects dont stack. Haste counters and negates slow.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXLvw6JXp3tIxLUdCc_target
attribs.current: Up to 13 Creatures, No Two of Which Can Be More than 30 ft. Apart

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXLzLzDBR4ekgW8UTN_description
attribs.current:
The mementor gains access to the targets memories and knowledge, and it can pry the information it wants from them involuntarily.

The mementor can attempt to learn the answer to one question of its choice per round; after each question, the target can attempt a Will saving throw to end the spell. If it fails, the creature can attempt a Bluff check with a DC equal to 47. If it fails its Bluff check, it gains the answer it desires. If it succeeds at its check, it gains no information. If it succeeds by 5 or more, it answers however it chooses and it believes that wrong answer to be the truth. Its questions are purely telepathic inquiries, and the answers to those questions are imparted directly into its mind. It and the target dont need to speak the same language, though less intelligent creatures may yield up only appropriate sensory images in answer to its questions.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXLAaFw42PX-f8EN82_description
attribs.current: The mementor stuns all creatures in range for [[1d4]] rounds. With a successful Will saving throw, a creature is instead sickened for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXLItXXSHrzL1ZLR6Z_description
attribs.current:
This spell causes confusion in all creatures in the area, making them unable to determine their actions. Any confused creature that is attacked automatically attacks or attempts to attack its attackers on its next turn, as long as it is still confused at the start of its next turn. Note that a confused creature will not make attacks of opportunity against any foe that it is not already devoted to attacking (either because of its most recent action or because it has just been attacked). For confused creatures that have not been attacked, roll on the following table at the start of each affected creatures turn each round to see what it does in that round.

A confused creature that cant carry out the indicated action does nothing but babble incoherently. Attackers are not at any special advantage when attacking a confused target.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXLr2Zj5tOnfBExVyk_description
attribs.current: Each round, the mementor concentrates on one target within range. It knows if the target deliberately and knowingly speaks a lie by discerning disturbances in its aura caused by lying. The spell does not reveal the truth or uncover unintentional inaccuracies, and it doesnt necessarily reveal evasions. Each round, it can concentrate on a different target.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXLr2Zj5tOnfBExVyk_target
attribs.current: Up to 13 Creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXLzLzDBR4ekgW8UTN_effect
attribs.current: Target must attempt a Bluff check and on a failure must answer truthfully.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXLzLzDBR4ekgW8UTN_save_effect
attribs.current: Target does not answer; if success by 5 or more, it can lie.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXM4h3u0b0sUOoxOEM_description
attribs.current:
The mementor reaches into the targets mind, extracts a specific memory, and projects that memory into a small hologram that plays in front of it and is visible to all creatures who can see it. The hologram memory can be no longer than 1 minute; if the extracted memory is longer than this, the hologram simply ends. The hologram includes audio as well as visual components, but it does not contain haptic, olfactory, or other components. The hologram typically plays a memory that takes place in a single scene, though it can cut to multiple scenes, if they are accurate to the memory and its length allows. The hologram plays the memory exactly as the target experienced it and from the targets perspective, so it often lacks context. The target creature must remain quiet and still while the hologram plays or the spell and hologram end.

This spell can target any living, unconscious, or deceased sentient creature with an Intelligence score of 3 or higher (or a modifier of 4 or higher). If the target is deceased, it cannot have been dead for longer than 1 week, or this spell fails; once a corpse has been subjected to hologram memory by any caster, any subsequent attempts to cast hologram memory on that corpse fail.

If the target is unwilling to share this memory (or if it would be unable to share the memory, in the case of an unconscious or deceased target), it can attempt a Will saving throw with a +4 bonus to negate this spell and its effects.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXM4h3u0b0sUOoxOEM_target
attribs.current: One Living or Deceased Sentient Creature; See Text

attribs.name: pilot_bonus
attribs.current: @{The Failed Doctor|whisper_state}&{template:sf_generic} {{name=@{character_name}}} {{characterid=@{character_id}}} {{title=^{pilot}}} {{r1=[[1d20+@{|piloting_ranks}[RNK]+[[({0,@{|piloting_ranks}}>1) * @{|piloting_class_skill}]][CS]+@{|piloting_ability}[ABI]+2-2@{|piloting_misc}@{The Failed Doctor|engines_status}@{The Failed Doctor|power_core_status}@{The Failed Doctor|computer_query}?{HELM PHASE INITIATIVE|NO, |YES,&{tracker}}]]}} {{r1name=}}

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNJ0qMzoSvYLlmiDth_effect
attribs.current: Target is slowed so long as it remains in the aura.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNJ0qMzoSvYLlmiDth_description
attribs.current: A field of mystical energy that slows time to a crawl extends in a 10-foot radius around the Failed Doctor. A creature that enters this area must succeed at a DC 20 Will saving throw or be slowed, as per slow, for as long as it remains in the aura and for 1 round after it leaves.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNI-Tm9VmcRq8O4UNh_description
attribs.current:
By touching the target (usually requiring a melee attack roll against the targets EAC, but the failed doctor can add its key ability score modifier instead of its Strength modifier if it is higher), the failed doctor floods the targets body with random jolts of electricity or other interference. On a failed Fortitude save, the target is overwhelmed and potentially unable to perform tasks as normal. While this spell is in effect, whenever the target takes any action or reaction, there is a 50% chance that the target simply takes no action instead. Roll this chance separately for each action the target would take. For example, if the target wishes to move and attack during its turn, it would roll d% twice to determine whether it could take those actionsonce before each action it wishes to take. Each attack of a full attack action counts as separate action.

This spell is effective against living and unliving creatures, and casting it doesnt provoke attacks of opportunity.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNI-Tm9VmcRq8O4UNh_effect
attribs.current: When taking an action or reaction, there is a 50% chance the target takes no action.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNI6JFj6D65ZLr2Is3_effect
attribs.current: All movements are halved and target takes [[3d6]] slashing damage per round as well as taking -2 penalty to Sense Motive, Charisma-based, and Dexterity-based skill and ability checks.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNI6JFj6D65ZLr2Is3_save_effect
attribs.current: Will Negates and Fortitude for Half Damage.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNI6JFj6D65ZLr2Is3_description
attribs.current:
Like rewriting the code that makes up a computer program, the failed doctor manipulates the targets DNA to painfully rewire that targets biological functions to mimic the cold and rigid processes of a robot. The target must succeed at a Will saving throw, or all of its movement speeds are halved and it takes 3d6 slashing damage per round on its turn as its internal organs shift and transform to become more like the inner components of a robot. Each round, the target can attempt a Fortitude saving throw to halve the damage this spell causes.

While this spell is in effect, the targets body becomes visibly more robotic; its voice is tinny and halting, its movements are jerky, and its face is unmoving and emotionless. The target has the flat-footed condition, and it takes a 2 penalty to all Sense Motive checks as well as to all Charisma-based and Dexterity-based skill and ability checks.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNIBRWwK19uF3fZD5M_description
attribs.current: The failed doctor causes an electrical device in his possession to surge in power and unleash a line of electricity from the massive oversurge. This deals 10d6 electricity damage to all creatures and objects in the area.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNIMfDy7oTBumb2d8v_description
attribs.current: The failed doctor can dissipate the charges from one technological object, temporarily depower one electrically powered technological object that does not use charges, or severely hinder a construct with the technological subtype. If the spell targets an object with charges, the object loses all of its remaining charges. If the object is powered by electrical means other than charges, its functions are suppressed for 1d4 rounds. If the spell targets a creature not of the technological subtype, it affects a random charged or electrically powered item in that creatures possession. If the target is a construct with the technological subtype, it is staggered and cannot use any energy-based attacks for 1d4 rounds. A construct with the technological subtype that is affected by this spell can attempt a Fortitude saving throw at the end of each round to shrug off the effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNIMfDy7oTBumb2d8v_effect
attribs.current: Object with charges loses all remaining charges and its functions suppressed for [[1d4]] rounds, creatures of the technological subtype are staggered and cannot use energy-based attacks for [[1d4]] rounds.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNIU-6s522TZ1x4e-H_description
attribs.current: The target of this spell appears to be about 2 feet away from its true location. The creature benefits from a 50% miss chance as if it had total concealment. Unlike actual total concealment, displacement doesnt prevent enemies from targeting the creature normally. True seeing reveals the targets true location and negates the miss chance. If a creature with blindsense can also see the displaced creature, the visual and blindsense information combined are enough for the creature with blindsense to attack the displaced creature without a miss chance, unlike normal for blindsense.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNIXPuixDLZkCdGZna_description
attribs.current: This spell floods the area of effect with dangerous radiation. The strength of the radiation the failed doctor create is high. The central irradiated area is always a 10-foot-radius spread that expands normally per the rules for radiation areas of effect (see page 403). Creatures within the area are exposed to the radiation only once; the radiation does not linger in the area. The saving throw to resist the radiation effects is set by the spell rather than the standard save DC for radiation.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNIcl98SPp6OA3FWLU_description
attribs.current: The failed doctor flings magical nanites that convert water vapor around its target into deadly acid. Make a ranged attack roll against its targets EAC. If it hit, the target takes 4d4 acid damage and it takes 5 additional acid damage at the end of its turn each round for the spells duration.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNIgAdWG35z2X3KhHE_effect
attribs.current: Target takes full damage and is confused for 10 rounds.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNIgAdWG35z2X3KhHE_save_effect
attribs.current: Target takes half damage and negates the effects of confusion.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNIgAdWG35z2X3KhHE_description
attribs.current:
The failed doctor concentrates key particles in its blood into tiny biological nanobots that it can inject into a foe with a touch, disrupting and damaging its natural processes. Make a melee attack against the targets EAC; if it hits, the nanobots deal 4d8 damage and swarm through the targets biological or mechanical systems, causing the creature to be confused, as per confusion, for 10 rounds. If the target succeeds at a Fortitude save, it takes only half damage and negates the confusion effect. A confused target can attempt a Will saving throw at the beginning of its turn each round to end the confusion effect.

Casting this spell doesnt provoke attacks of opportunity.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The Failed Doctor begins by casting displacement on itself, and then it attempts to affect two random targets with overload systems and rewire flesh. It then relies on damaging spells to take out the PCs.

Morale The Failed Doctor fights until it is destroyed.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The Surgeon sprays its anaesthesia cone as often as possible in an attempt to knock out PCs. If the Surgeon is ever left alone in the room with only unconscious creatures, it drags one of them onto the table, where it can strap them down and begin a painful vivisection.

Morale The Surgeon fights until it is destroyed.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNR9VbcSH9DjiiZaHz_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, the Surgeon can spray a 15-foot cone of anaesthetic liquid that seeps through targets armour and into their skin. A living creature caught within the cone is sickened for 1d6 rounds unless it succeeds at a DC 21 Fortitude save. If a living sickened creature fails its save against this effect, it gains the fatigued condition, and a living fatigued creature is rendered unconscious for 6 hours on a failed save. An unconscious creature can be awoken by any amount of magical healing or by a spell or effect that removes the fatigued condition.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNR9VbcSH9DjiiZaHz_effect
attribs.current: Living creature is sickened for [[1d6]] Rounds; if it fails again, it becomes fatigued; if it fails again then it becomes unconscious for 6 hours.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNRERElzv8JfR46wq0_description
attribs.current: The surgeon can nauseate targets that it damages. A living creature that takes damage from the its scalpel is nauseated for 1 round; the target can negate the effect with a successful DC 21 Fortitude save.

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Aphelion Laser Rifle with 2 High-Capacity Batteries (40 Charges each), Singer Velstrac Flenser with 2 Batteries (20 Charges each); Augmentations: Accelerated Datajack, Mk 2 Dermal Plating, Respiration Compounder, Standard Speed Suspension, Vocal Modulator

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXXHYe858JJ5g2QhGC_description
attribs.current: A heretics visage causes viewers to doubt all of their most deeply held convictions. A creature that fails a DC 16 Will saving throw against this gaze is confused for 1 round. This is a mind-affecting effect.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The heretics remain at range, firing their laser rifles at the most vulnerable-looking PCs.

Morale The heretics fight to the death.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXXWyTziRZ0ZQaSPxCL_description
attribs.current: Velstracs wield flensers blades designed to slice skin from muscle and muscle from bonesometimes mounting these knives on rifles as bayonets. Flensers are honed to supernatural sharpness and powered to vibrate with the rhythms of the wielders body. Velstracs have mastered the art of using these advanced melee weapons to inflict wounds while keeping targets alive. The table above shows an array of flensers, which can be purchased only in the darkest corners of the galaxy.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXXX6kZeMLSbUZmyg0Q_description
attribs.current: With its snub, squared barrel and internal reinforcements, a laser rifle is sturdy and dependable.
