pilot_bonus
attribs.current: @{Dr Lestana Gragant|whisper_state}&{template:sf_generic} {{name=@{character_name}}} {{characterid=@{character_id}}} {{title=^{pilot}}} {{r1=[[1d20+@{|piloting_ranks}[RNK]+[[({0,@{|piloting_ranks}}>1) * @{|piloting_class_skill}]][CS]+@{|piloting_ability}[ABI]+2-2@{|piloting_misc}@{Dr Lestana Gragant|engines_status}@{Dr Lestana Gragant|power_core_status}@{Dr Lestana Gragant|computer_query}?{HELM PHASE INITIATIVE|NO, |YES,&{tracker}}]]}} {{r1name=}}

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat Dr Gragant begins combat by using displacement on herself. She targets any obvious melee fighters with unwilling guardian and sets them to protecting her from other melee fighters while casting dimension door to stay out of range of anyone trying to pin her in place. She targets a PC injured by a vespers hound with mind thrust or synapse overload to finish them off and uses resilient sphere to trap the PC who is causing her the most trouble.

Morale Dr Gragant fights until she is reduced to 0 Hit Points, though this might not mean her destruction (see Development below).

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Estex Suit IV (Grey Force Field [20 HP], Mk 3 Electrostatic Field, Mk 1 Spell Reflector), Ultrathin Dagger

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNXGwU8A8VfOdomJYw_description
attribs.current: Dr Gragants corporeal form occasionally flickers into insubstantial shadow. She has a 50% chance to ignore (treat as a normal hit) extra damage and critical hit effects from a critical hit from any weapon, unless that weapon has the ghost killer fusion or can otherwise affect incorporeal creatures normally.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNWJ2WtSlEolWl1nZJ_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, Dr Gragant can cause terrible pain in a living target that she can see. If the target fails a DC 19 Fortitude save, it is stunned for 1 round. This is a mind-affecting pain effect. A creature that succeeds at its saving throw against this effect is immune to it for 24 hours.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXNWCtzg8jamxE3YKNC_description
attribs.current: The thinness and lightness of daggers make them easy to carry or conceal. Ultrathin daggers have sharp, double-edged blades. Most daggers are available with fixed, folding, or retractable blades.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNWNOkY5nUK9MvGF6k_description
attribs.current:
To affect the target, Dr Lestana Gragant must hit with a melee attack against its EAC; she can add her key ability score modifier to this attack roll instead of her Strength modifier if it is higher. She then overloads the targets mind, causing the targets synapses to violently trigger. The target takes 18d8 damage and is staggered for 1 minute. A target can negate the staggered effect with a successful Fortitude saving throw, but still takes full damage.

Casting this spell doesnt provoke attacks of opportunity.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNWNOkY5nUK9MvGF6k_effect
attribs.current: Full Damage and is Staggered for 1 Minute.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNWRYRh6pg9h-CzqDU_target
attribs.current: One Creature with CR Lower than Dr Lestana Gragant's CR

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNWRYRh6pg9h-CzqDU_description
attribs.current:
Dr Lestana Gragant's overwhelming presence bores into the targets mind, cowing its will. This turns it into an automaton-like guardian that protects her at all costs. As soon as it is able, the target mindlessly moves along the most direct route toward her and stops when it is within 10 feet of her (provoking attacks of opportunity for movement as normal). If she is being attacked in melee by a creature within 10 feet, the target instead takes the quickest route to intercept that creature from a square within 10 feet of her and attack it on her behalf.

While this spell is in effect, the target attacks any creature that attacks her in melee, though it cant move more than 10 feet from her to do so. If multiple creatures are attacking her in melee, she can choose which creature the target attacks on her behalf as part of combat banter. If she is the target of ranged attacks and her guardian is not attacking a melee assailant on her behalf, it moves to provide cover against the ranged attacks. Due to the strong momentary connection between her and her unwilling guardian, if she is the single target of a hostile creatures spell or effect, the creature must succeed at a caster level check (DC = 6 + her caster level) or the spell or effect instead targets her guardian. This spell has no effect on area of effect or multi-target spells or other effects that include her as a target.

When this spell ends, the target regains control of its faculties entirely and it knows and remembers that she used magic to control it. Once a creature has been the target of unwilling guardian, it cant be targeted with this spell again for 24 hours if cast by the same spellcaster.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNWUTyiZLcB-Id3wVo_description
attribs.current:
Dr Lestana Gragant instantly transfers herself from her current location to any other spot within range. She always arrives at exactly the spot desiredwhether by simply visualizing the area or by stating its direction. She can bring along objects as long as their weight doesnt exceed her maximum load. She can also bring up to four additional willing or unconscious Medium or smaller creatures (carrying gear or objects up to their maximum load) or their equivalent. A Large creature counts as two Medium creatures, and a Huge creature counts as two Large creatures. All creatures to be transported must be in contact with one another, and at least one of those creatures must be in contact with her. After using this spell, she cant take any other actions until her next turn (and each creature traveling with her cant take any other actions until its next turn).

If she arrives in a place that is already occupied by a solid body, she and each creature traveling with her each take [[1d6]] damage and are shunted to a random open space on a suitable surface within 100 feet of the intended location. If there is no free space within 100 feet, she and each creature traveling with her take [[2d6]] additional damage and are shunted to a free space within 1,000 feet. If there is no free space within 1,000 feet, she and each creature traveling with her take [[4d6]] additional damage and the spell simply fails.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNWUTyiZLcB-Id3wVo_target
attribs.current: Dr Lestana Gragant and Touched Objects or Touched Willing or Unconscious Creatures

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNWb2NOX5pwDoQYExC_description
attribs.current: Dr Lestana Gragant divines the most vulnerable portion of her opponents mind and overload it with a glut of psychic information. The target can attempt a Will saving throw to halve the damage dealt by this spell. This spell has no effect on creatures without an Intelligence score.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNWb2NOX5pwDoQYExC_effect
attribs.current: Half Damage and target is fatigued for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNWfgM0jxYnRnTZZDZ_description
attribs.current: A 10-foot-diameter globe of shimmering force encloses the target creature. The sphere contains the target for the spells duration. The sphere functions in the same way as a wall of force, except it can be negated by dispel magic. A target inside the sphere can breathe normally. The sphere cant be physically moved either by creatures outside it or by the struggles of those within.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNWlYKvOIu-NlKk1g0_description
attribs.current:
Like rewriting the code that makes up a computer program, Dr Lestana Gragant manipulates the targets DNA to painfully rewire that targets biological functions to mimic the cold and rigid processes of a robot. The target must succeed at a Will saving throw, or all of its movement speeds are halved and it takes 3d6 slashing damage per round on its turn as its internal organs shift and transform to become more like the inner components of a robot. Each round, the target can attempt a Fortitude saving throw to halve the damage this spell causes.

While this spell is in effect, the targets body becomes visibly more robotic; its voice is tinny and halting, its movements are jerky, and its face is unmoving and emotionless. The target has the flat-footed condition, and it takes a 2 penalty to all Sense Motive checks as well as to all Charisma-based and Dexterity-based skill and ability checks.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNWlYKvOIu-NlKk1g0_effect
attribs.current: All movements are halved and target takes [[3d6]] slashing damage per round as well as taking -2 penalty to Sense Motive, Charisma-based, and Dexterity-based skill and ability checks.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNWlYKvOIu-NlKk1g0_save_effect
attribs.current: Will Negates and Fortitude for Half Damage.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNWpgn9jheZi4HggU9_description
attribs.current: Dr Lestana Gragant causes an electrical device in his possession to surge in power and unleash a line of electricity from the massive oversurge. This deals 10d6 electricity damage to all creatures and objects in the area.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXNWscLOvsn43G-9qEt_description
attribs.current: The target of this spell appears to be about 2 feet away from its true location. The creature benefits from a 50% miss chance as if it had total concealment. Unlike actual total concealment, displacement doesnt prevent enemies from targeting the creature normally. True seeing reveals the targets true location and negates the miss chance. If a creature with blindsense can also see the displaced creature, the visual and blindsense information combined are enough for the creature with blindsense to attack the displaced creature without a miss chance, unlike normal for blindsense.

attribs.name: abilities_menu
languages
attribs.current: Castrovelian, Common, Up to 5 Others; Limited Telepathy 30 ft.

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Operative Exploits (Cloaking Field, Master of Disguise [3/Day, 100 Minutes or 10 Minutes, DC 19]), Specialization (Ghost)

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Freebooter Armour III, Advanced Shirren-Eye Rifle with 12 Sniper Rounds, Elite Semi-Auto Pistol with 36 Small Arm Rounds, Incapacitator with 1 Battery (20 Charges)

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXS2FDDCe5N8oOlcNWM_description
attribs.current: When this nonreflective, dark-grey baton connects with a target, it discharges an electrical pulse that can stagger its victim.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXS2PxoF62J0hFf0d9B_description
attribs.current: The semiautomatic mechanism of this pistol discharges spent cartridges and reloads fresh ones in the barrel, provided a cartridge remains in the magazine.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXS2VKamAySI9RbfYAW_description
attribs.current: Shirren-eye rifles are named for their compound sights, which resemble the eyes of the insectile race, but are rarely manufactured by shirren companies. Shirren-eye rifles are extremely accurate and favoured by snipers and sharpshooters.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXS2jxYJMeM5RH3ReHy_description
attribs.current:
The mercenary commando detects the surface thoughts of intelligent creatures around them. The amount of information revealed depends on how long you study a particular area or target.

1st Round: The mercenary commando detects the presence or absence of thoughts from conscious creatures that have Intelligence scores of at least 1 (or an Intelligence modifier of 5) or higher.

2nd Round: The mercenary commando detects the number of thinking minds and the Intelligence score (or modifier) of each. If the highest Intelligence score is 26 (or a modifier of +8) or higher and at least 10 points higher than their own Intelligence score (or 5 points higher than their own Intelligence modifier), they are stunned for 1 round and the spell ends. This spell doesnt let them determine the location of the thinking minds if they cant see the creatures whose thoughts they are detecting.

3rd Round: The mercenary commando can read the surface thoughts of any mind in the area. A target who succeeds at its Will save prevents them from reading its thoughts, and they must cast detect thoughts again to have another chance. Creatures of animal intelligence (an Intelligence score of 1 or 2 or an Intelligence modifier of 4 or lower) have simple, instinctual thoughts.

Each round, they can turn to detect thoughts in a new area. The spell can penetrate barriers, but 3 feet of dirt or wood, 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or any force field blocks it.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXS2rWxyVJc8tTdliKU_description
attribs.current: This spell short-circuits the mind of a humanoid creature with a CR of 3 or lower so that it is dazed (unable to take actions, but taking no penalty to AC). Humanoids of CR 4 or higher are not affected. After a creature has been dazed by this spell, it is immune to it for 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXS2rWxyVJc8tTdliKU_target
attribs.current: One Humanoid Creature of CR 3 or Lower

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXS2x8VZM-0v8bQFKTg_description
attribs.current: The mercenary commando points their finger at the target object, gaining the ability to lift it and move it at will from a distance. As a move action, they can propel the object as far as 15 feet in any direction, though the spell ends if the distance between them and the object ever exceeds the spells range. They cant perform complex operations, such as firing a gun or using a computer, but they can shut a mechanical door or lid and work simple buttons to open or close automated doors or trigger an alarm.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXS2x8VZM-0v8bQFKTg_target
attribs.current: One Unattended Object of No More Than 10 lbs. or 1 Bulk

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXS2bNdRg7lmJV-Tcvs_description
attribs.current: When the mercenary commando succeeds at both the skill check and attack roll of their trick attack, they can make the target flat-footed or off-target until the beginning of their next turn. They might learn exploits that grant them additional options for their debilitating trick, but they can select only one option each time they hit with a trick attack.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXS2dhdLbJFYHqF2SK5_description
attribs.current: The mercenary commando can trick or startle a foe and then attack when she drops her guard. As a full action, they can move up to their speed. Whether or not they moved, they can then make an attack with a melee weapon with the operative special property or with any small arm. Just before making their attack, attempt a Bluff, Intimidate, or Stealth check (or a check associated with your specialization; see page 94) with a DC equal to 20 + their targets CR. If they succeed at the check, they deal 5d8 additional damage and the target is flat-footed against their attack. They cant use this ability with a weapon that has the unwieldy special property or that requires a full action to make a single attack.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXS2ga19DGxjUAGxNDj_description
attribs.current: When making a full attack using only melee weapons with the operative special property or small arms, the mercenary commando can make up to three attacks instead of two.

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Advanced Lashunta Tempweave, Advanced Semi-Auto Pistol with 24 Small Arm Rounds, Tactical Knife

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXS7OZV4NLLUCTfRxA0_description
attribs.current: These light blades can be used for both mundane tasks and combat. Tactical knives have large, double-edged blades, often with a section of serrated blade near the haft, and they come in both fixed- and folding-blade designs; users may prefer one style or the other, but the two are identical in terms of price, weight, and damage dealt.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXS7Uf-FqXnJSPfUhIN_description
attribs.current: The semiautomatic mechanism of this pistol discharges spent cartridges and reloads fresh ones in the barrel, provided a cartridge remains in the magazine.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MXS7wP8F58X28ZE0EFc_description
attribs.current: The mercenary technomancer causes an electrical device in their possession to surge in power and unleash a line of electricity from the massive oversurge. This deals 10d6 electricity damage to all creatures and objects in the area.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MXS8L0KzQGPPHQRvqyp_description
attribs.current:
The mercenary technomancer weaves nearby photons into illusory holograms that can take almost any form they can imagine. These holograms are usually effective against cameras, robots, and living creatures.

When the mercenary technomancer casts holographic image as a 1st-level spell, it produces a purely visual hologram at long range (720 feet). The image has no sound, smell, texture, or temperature. The image cant extend beyond four 10-foot cubes plus one 10-foot cube per caster level. The image lasts for as long as they concentrate. They can move the image within the limits of the size of the effect.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MXS8-VO-dZ4jhP2jozh_description
attribs.current:
Any unattended, manufactured (built from component parts, including metal, wood, plastic, glass, and so on) item you touch crumbles into dust, rust, and decay. If the item is so large that it cant fit within a 3-foot radius, a 3-foot-radius volume of the material is destroyed. This is an instantaneous effect.

The mercenary technomancer can employ entropic grasp in combat by making a melee attack against their opponents EAC. If they hit, they instantaneously reduce a manufactured armours KAC and EAC bonus by 3 (to a minimum of a +0 bonus). Damaged armour can be repaired using the Engineering skill; with a successful check, the armours armour bonuses are restored to their original values. Against a manufactured creature (generally constructs, but not undead), this attack instead deals 6d12 damage.

Weapons and equipment in use by an opponent are more difficult to affect with this spell. They attempt a sunder combat manoeuvre against the item. If successful, they deal [[6d6]] damage to the weapon or item.

Used in combat, this spell lasts 8 rounds, and they can make one melee attack each round on future rounds as a standard action. The target can attempt a save to negate each melee attack, but success does not end the spell.

Casting this spell doesnt provoke attacks of opportunity.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MXS8-VO-dZ4jhP2jozh_target
attribs.current: One nonmagical manufactured object (or the volume of the object within a 3-ft.-radius of the touched point) or one manufactured creature touched each round

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MXS86hw1xRDn0TWbdl6_description
attribs.current: The mercenary technomancer flings magical nanites that convert water vapor around its target into deadly acid. Make a ranged attack roll against its targets EAC. If it hit, the target takes 4d4 acid damage and it takes 5 additional acid damage at the end of its turn each round for the spells duration.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MXS894gPSBYLr-SZpE9_description
attribs.current:
The mercenary technomancer concentrates key particles in its blood into tiny biological nanobots that it can inject into a foe with a touch, disrupting and damaging its natural processes. Make a melee attack against the targets EAC; if it hits, the nanobots deal 4d8 damage and swarm through the targets biological or mechanical systems, causing the creature to be confused, as per confusion, for 10 rounds. If the target succeeds at a Fortitude save, it takes only half damage and negates the confusion effect. A confused target can attempt a Will saving throw at the beginning of its turn each round to end the confusion effect.

Casting this spell doesnt provoke attacks of opportunity.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MXS894gPSBYLr-SZpE9_save_effect
attribs.current: Target takes half damage and negates the effects of confusion.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MXS894gPSBYLr-SZpE9_effect
attribs.current: Target takes full damage and is confused for 10 rounds.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MXS8CnozsYZvxjMoW3w_description
attribs.current:
The creature or object touched becomes invisible (see page 264). If the target is a creature, any gear it is carrying vanishes as well. If the mercenary technomancer casts the spell on someone else, neither they nor their allies can see the target unless they can normally see invisible things or they employ magic to do so.

The spell ends if the target attacks any creature. For purposes of this spell, an attack includes any spell or harmful effect targeting a foe or whose area or effect includes a foe. Actions directed at unattended objects dont break the spell. Spells that specifically affect allies but not foes are not attacks for this purpose, even when they include foes in their area. Causing harm indirectly is not an attack. Thus, an invisible being can open doors, talk, eat, climb stairs, summon security forces and have them attack, start a trash compactor with foes inside, remotely trigger traps, and so forth.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MXS8CnozsYZvxjMoW3w_target
attribs.current: One Creature or Object No More than 80 Bulk

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MXS8EdYs8kzC135MPLY_description
attribs.current:
The mercenary technomancer pulls latent technological energy from the air to form a cloud of fist-sized hindering microbots that fill an area they designate. The microbots begin in a 10-foot-square area when they create them, and they can create the cloud so that it shares the space of other creatures. If no creatures are within the clouds area, the microbots pursue and harass the nearest creature that is hostile to them as best they can each round. Although the microbots generally know which creatures are their enemies, they have no control over their targets or direction of travel. If there are multiple valid targets the microbots can harass, the cloud will split into a maximum of four 5-foot-square segments and pursue different targets.

The cloud (and any segments thereof) has a fly speed of 20 feet. Each round on the mercenary technomancer's turn, the microbot cloud grants harrying fire (see page 247) against the foes in its spaces. In addition, the cloud grants covering fire (see page 246) to anyone attacked by foes in its spaces. The microbots constantly repair themselves and the cloud generates new microbots every few seconds, so any attack against them is essentially ineffective.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MXS8O9jEtlHafohf9H3_description
attribs.current:
The mercenary technomancer fires two missiles of magical energy that strike targets unerringly (the creatures must still be valid targets) and deal 1d4+1 damage each. They cant target specific parts of a creature, and objects are not damaged by the spell.

The mercenary technomancer can target a single creature or several creatures, but each missile can strike only one creature. They must designate targets before they attempt to overcome spell resistance or roll damage.

The mercenary technomancer can cast this spell as a full action. If they do, you fire three missiles instead of two.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MXS8O9jEtlHafohf9H3_target
attribs.current: Up to three creatures, no two of which can be more than 15 ft. apart; see text

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXS7pqk627f29EEIWEr_description
attribs.current:
As the culmination of the mercenary technomancer's early study of the fundamental forces of the galaxy, they have created a spell cache that allows them to store and access spells. Their spell cache could be a device such as a handheld computer or technological implant; an item such as a ring or staff; or a symbol such as a brand, tattoo, or other permanent modification to their body. While they dont need their spell cache to cast their spells, once per day, they can activate their spell cache to cast any one spell they know and are capable of casting, even if theyve expended all their spell slots for that spells level.

If the mercenary technomancer's spell cache is damaged, it is restored to full Hit Points the next time you regain their daily allotment of spell slots. If the spell cache is lost or destroyed, they can replace it after 1 week with a special ritual that takes 8 hours to complete.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXS7eWJpAIrEwVOwa9h_description
attribs.current: The mercenary technomancer expands their spell cache into a cache capacitor. As part of regaining their spells each day, they can cast a single spell into their spell cache and have it affect them continuously for 24 hours. The cache capacitor can hold any of the following spells: detect radiation, disguise self, keen senses, or unseen servant. They must know a spell to store it in their cache capacitor. When they cast the spell into their cache capacitor, they expend the spell slot normally and make any decisions required for that spell, but the duration doesnt expire for 24 hours. If the spell in their cache capacitor is dispelled or dismissed, they can spend 5 minutes of uninterrupted concentration to reestablish it, keeping the same decisions they made when they cast it, and gaining whatever duration the spell had remaining. They cant exchange the stored spell for another spell until they again regains their spells.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXS7hj-76Zuu6cLtvvT_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, the mercenary technomancer can spend 1 RP to temporarily suppress magic, as if using dispel magic. Choose either an ongoing spell or a magic item within 30 feet of them. The magical effects of the spell or magic item are suppressed for [[1d4]] rounds, and then they return. If the spells level is higher than their can cast or the items level is greater than their level, you cant suppress it. If they target a spell affecting a creature, the creature can attempt a Will save to stop them from suppressing the spell.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXS7maFsqwAT5-tJHuD_description
attribs.current: When the mercenary technomancer casts an instantaneous spell with an area effect, they can shape the spell so it doesnt affect one of their allies. Choose one 5-foot square within the spells area to be unaffected by the spell. At 5th level, they can spend 1 Resolve Point to exclude any number of squares with this ability.

attribs.name: save_notes
attribs.current: +2 vs. Disease, Mind-Affecting Effects, Poison, and Sleep

attribs.name: languages
attribs.current: Akitonian, Castrovelian, Common, Elven, Triaxian, Vercite

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Constructed, Envoy Improvisations (Improved Get 'Em, Hidden Agenda, Improved Hurry, Not in the Face), Flat Affect, Upgrade Slot (Mk 2 Resistor)

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Bespoke Echelon Fashion, Gravity Battleglove with 1 Battery (20 Charges), Advanced Gyrojet Pistol with 20 Mini-Rockets; Augmentations: Backup Lobe, Cloaking Skin, Mk 2 Force Soles, Parallax Optical Laser, Complete Speed Suspension

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSJdbmr4Ifhi29QM8N_description
attribs.current: The first time Asher-34 takes Hit Point damage in a given encounter, for 1 round he can roll attack rolls, saving throws, and skill checks twice and use the better result. He can do so again first time he drops below half his Hit Points in a given encounter.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXSIkMx8lR9SYIOaIRy_description
attribs.current: Battlegloves are popular, economical choices for mercenaries and guards. These Durable nylon-web or para-aramid gloves hold a weighted plate over the wearers knuckles. You can hold other objects or Weapons in a hand wearing a glove, but you cant use the glove to make Attacks while doing so.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXSIpjlC7KZl6ocI3l5_description
attribs.current: Gyrojet pistols fire Mini-Rockets that can hit with a force great enough to knock down Targets. Gyrojet pistols are slightly larger than semiautomatic pistols, and they have a reinforced barrel.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXSIwZMcBdbh5W8bFx9_description
attribs.current: This system replaces one of Asher-34's eyes with a compact laser weapon that functions as a small arm with the integrated weapon special property and deals damage based on its model. An optical laser has a 50-foot range increment, and it cant be disarmed. Once he's used the optical laser for a single attack, its tiny battery is depleted; he cant use it again until youve rested for 10 minutes to regain Stamina Points, though he can spend 1 Resolve Point at any point to recharge it immediately.

senses
attribs.current: Blindsight (Vibration, 30 ft.), Darkvision (60 ft.), Low-Light Vision, True Seeing

attribs.name: immunities
attribs.current: Cold, Fear Effects, Nonlethal Damage, Pain Effects

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Freebooter Armour V (Mk 2 Spell Reflector, Teleportation Unit, Vibration Sensors)

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSNLlZ6xVlS-3WnfFy_description
attribs.current: Whenever a creature succeeds at a Will save against one of Ylenkas spells or abilities, negating its effect, the creature takes 15 nonlethal damage. This is a mind-affecting pain effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSP-qjClIFfxTUJnpD_description
attribs.current: Ylenka can make ranged attacks with her chain barbs with a range increment of 60 feet and a maximum range of 300 feet. These weapons have the entangle special property.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXSN9Ls8ITPO4pZJ0x3_description
attribs.current: Ylenka can make ranged attacks with her chain barbs with a range increment of 60 feet and a maximum range of 300 feet. These weapons have the entangle special property.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSNNriQBhWI2Cu1Dtq_description
attribs.current: Ylenka is capable of performing swift surgical operations upon targets that are helpless or that she currently has grappled. Against such a target, any hit with Ylenkas chain claws counts as a critical hit with the severe wound critical hit effect (although she can choose the bleed effect instead) with a save DC of 25. If Ylenka actually scores a critical hit against such a target, she rolls the damage three times instead of twice, and the save DC increases to 27. When Ylenka uses this ability to wound a target, the lost flesh immediately grafts to her body, restoring [[3d8+11]] Hit Points and removing one condition affecting Ylenka.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSQ82Qn5kaPTsyT8Zd_description
attribs.current: As a full action that provokes attacks of opportunity, Ylenka can peer across the boundary of a plane she is on into the coterminous area on another plane. For instance, she can use this ability to peer from the Ethereal Plane or Shadow Plane into the connected area of the Material Plane, or vice versa. While she peers into a conterminous plane, Ylenkas attention is focused on that plane. She is only dimly aware of her actual surroundings and takes a 10 penalty to Perception checks related to occurrences there. By using a full action each round to concentrate, Ylenka can maintain this ability indefinitely.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSQRpYONvH-H1TBeik_description
attribs.current: Ylenka can oscillate her form between the Shadow Plane and Material Plane while moving, allowing her to pass through material objects other than corporeal creatures. She must start and end her turn outside any such object. In addition, attacks made against her while shes moving have a 20% miss chance.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSQa0-twk3QdTrYd-3_description
attribs.current: Whenever a creature damages Ylenka, she can spend 1 Resolve Point to reduce the damage by 20, up to the attacks total damage. If Ylenka does so, the creature that dealt the damage must succeed at a DC 25 Will save or take the damage Ylenka didnt take due to using this ability. This is a mind-affecting pain effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSNSNap1Z-aEGmkeFZ_description
attribs.current: A creature that succumbs to Ylenkas unnerving gaze becomes confused for 1 round as its mind floods with the possibilities of the past, present, and future, unbridled by restraint. This is a mind-affecting effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSNbPJkAR0YFVzUBZo_description
attribs.current:
This spell functions as teleport, except there is no hard range limit and Ylenka doesnt need to have seen its destination. She can teleport to anywhere she is familiar with on the planet she is on while casting the spell, or she can teleport to any other planet in the same solar system. She must have an unambiguous idea of which world she wishes to travel to (the third planet from the sun is an acceptable destination, but a habitable world with oceans is not). If she has a specific location on a planet in mind, she arrives there without a chance of failure; otherwise, she arrives at a location that would not immediately be life threatening. If no such safe landing zone exists on the world, such as someone attempting to travel into the sun without the proper precautions in place, the spell simply fails.

Ylenka can also attempt to teleport to planets in different solar systems that she has visited before. This increases the casting time to 1 hour and costs a number of Resolve Points equal to the number of days she would take to reach the planet through Drift travel (assume a base engine with a Drift rating of 1; the GM rolls this randomly, after she begins casting the spell). If she doesnt have enough Resolve Points, she spends all the Resolve Points she has available and the spell fails.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSNbPJkAR0YFVzUBZo_target
attribs.current: Ylenka and Touched Objects or Touched Willing or Unconscious Creatures

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSNbPJkAR0YFVzUBZo_range
attribs.current: Solar System or Plane; See Text

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSNfnrWYDiDyHZBZ1W_description
attribs.current:
To use shadow walk, Ylenka must be in an area of dim light. She and any creature or vehicle she touches are then transported along a coiling path of shadowstuff to the edge of the Material Plane where it borders the Plane of Shadow. The effect is largely illusory, but the path is quasi-real.

All targets affected must be in direct contact with one another. A Large target counts as two Medium targets, a Huge target counts as four Medium targets, and so forth. Creatures Ylenka transports this way can opt to follow her, wander off through the plane, or stumble back into the Material Plane (50% chance for either of the latter results if the creatures are lost or abandoned by her). Creatures unwilling to accompany her into the Plane of Shadow can attempt a Will saving throw to negate the effect.

In the region of shadow, she moves at a rate of 200 miles per hour. Because of the blurring of reality between the Plane of Shadow and the Material Plane, she cant make out details of the terrain or areas she passes over during transit nor can she predict perfectly where her travel will end. Its impossible to judge distances accurately, making the spell virtually useless for scouting or spying. Furthermore, when the spell effect ends, she is shunted [[1d10*100]] feet in a random horizontal direction from her desired endpoint. If this would place her within a solid object, she (and any creatures with it) is shunted to the nearest empty space available, but the strain of this activity renders each creature fatigued (no saving throw).

Shadow walk can also be used to travel to other planes that border on the Plane of Shadow (except for the Drift), but this usage requires her to travel across the Plane of Shadow to arrive at a border with another plane of reality, which takes [[1d4]] hours.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSNfnrWYDiDyHZBZ1W_target
attribs.current: Up to 18 Medium Creatures of Vehicles

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSNjT4VNFHcNhyCloh_target
attribs.current: Constructs of the technological subtype with individual CRs no greater than 19 and a total CR no greater than 38, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSNjT4VNFHcNhyCloh_description
attribs.current:
Ylenka wrests control of the target constructs and command them telepathically. SHe can issue commands to any number of controlled constructs on her turn, beginning when she casts this spell, as part of the concentration required to sustain its duration (a standard action).

If any of the constructs are under the control of a hostile creature, that controlling creature can attempt a Will saving throw (DC 24) to negate this spells effect. Each construct under the control of another creature grants its controlling creature a separate saving throw to negate the effect for that construct.

While this spell is in effect, the affected constructs follow any command Ylenka gives them, even if it would be dangerous to the controlled constructs. At the end of the spell, the constructs revert to their normal behaviour. If they are intelligent, they know and remember that she used magic to control them.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSNsFQFrZy-vdPVxH8_description
attribs.current: Ylenka divines the most vulnerable portion of her opponents mind and overload it with a glut of psychic information. The target can attempt a Will saving throw to halve the damage dealt by this spell. This spell has no effect on creatures without an Intelligence score.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSNsFQFrZy-vdPVxH8_effect
attribs.current: Full damage and target is exhausted for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSNsFQFrZy-vdPVxH8_save_effect
attribs.current: Half damage and target is fatigued for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSNxNitJZC2FKvsZOW_description
attribs.current: Psychic surgery heals the target of all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma damage, and it restores all points permanently drained from the targets Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. It also eliminates all ongoing confusion, fear, and insanity effects. Psychic surgery also removes any mental afflictions that could be removed with dispel magic, as well as mental diseases. Psychic surgery removes all effects magically altering the targets memory, even instantaneous effects, and it can restore a memory to perfect clarity (even if the memory loss is due to the mundane passage of time).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSNxNitJZC2FKvsZOW_target
attribs.current: One Willing or Unconscious, Living Creature

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSO4fzYOoNL6exUC33_description
attribs.current:
Ylenka's overwhelming presence bores into the targets mind, cowing its will. This turns it into an automaton-like guardian that protects her at all costs. As soon as it is able, the target mindlessly moves along the most direct route toward her and stops when it is within 10 feet of her (provoking attacks of opportunity for movement as normal). If she is being attacked in melee by a creature within 10 feet, the target instead takes the quickest route to intercept that creature from a square within 10 feet of her and attack it on her behalf.

While this spell is in effect, the target attacks any creature that attacks Ylenka in melee, though it cant move more than 10 feet from her to do so. If multiple creatures are attacking her in melee, she can choose which creature the target attacks on her behalf as part of combat banter. If she is the target of ranged attacks and her guardian is not attacking a melee assailant on her behalf, it moves to provide cover against the ranged attacks. Due to the strong momentary connection between her and her unwilling guardian, if she is the single target of a hostile creatures spell or effect, the creature must succeed at a caster level check (DC 24) or the spell or effect instead targets her guardian. This spell has no effect on area of effect or multi-target spells or other effects that include her as a target.

When this spell ends, the target regains control of its faculties entirely and it knows and remembers that Ylenka used magic to control it. Once a creature has been the target of unwilling guardian, it cant be targeted with this spell again for 24 hours if cast by the same spellcaster.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSO4fzYOoNL6exUC33_target
attribs.current: One Creature with CR Lower than 18; See Text

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSOAY6D6-2hxBI0jzS_description
attribs.current:
Ylenka reaches into the targets mind and modify up to 5 minutes of its memories in one of the following ways.
Eliminate all memory of an event the target actually experienced. This spell cannot negate charm person, suggestion, or similar spells.
Allow the target to recall with perfect clarity an event it actually experienced.
Change the details of an event the target actually experienced.
Implant a memory of an event the target never experienced.
Casting the spell takes 1 round. If the target fails its saving throw, Ylenka proceeds with the spell by spending as much as 5 minutes (a period of time equal to the amount of memory she wants to modify) visualizing the memory she wishes to modify in the target. If her concentration is disturbed before the visualization is complete, or if the target moves beyond the spells range at any point during this time, the spell fails.

A modified memory does not necessarily affect the targets actions, particularly if it contradicts the creatures natural inclinations. An illogical modified memory is usually dismissed as a bad dream, a hallucination, or another similar excuse.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSOG9JvWXEp2H83k6L_duration
attribs.current: Concentration (Up to 18 Rounds) or Instantaneous; See Text

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSOG9JvWXEp2H83k6L_description
attribs.current:
Ylenka moves objects or creatures by concentrating on them. Depending on her desired effect (choose one from below), the spell can perform a variety of combat maneuvers, provide a gentle, sustained force, or exert a single short, violent thrust.

Combat Maneuver: Once per round, Ylenka can use telekinesis to perform a ranged attack that acts as a bull rush, disarm, grapple (including pin), or trip combat maneuver. Resolve these attempts as normal, but use her caster level plus her key ability score modifier as her attack bonus. No saving throw is allowed against these attempts, but spell resistance applies normally. This version of the spell can last 1 round per caster level, but it ends if she ceases concentrating.

Sustained Force: A sustained force moves an object of no more than 25 pounds or 9 bulk up to 20 feet per round in any direction (including up or down). A creature can negate the effect on an object it holds with a successful Will save or with spell resistance. This version of the spell lasts 18 rounds, but it ends if Ylenka ceases concentrating. The spell ends if the object is forced beyond the spells range.

Ylenka can telekinetically manipulate an object as if with one hand. For example, a lever can be pulled, a key turned, a button pushed, an object rotated, and so on if the force required is within the weight limitation. She might even be able to untie simple knots, though a delicate activity such as this requires a successful DC 15 Intelligence check.

Violent Thrust: The spell energy can be spent in a single round. Ylenka can hurl up to 15 objects or creatures that are within range (no two of which can be more than 10 feet apart) toward any target within 150 feet of all the objects. She can hurl up to a total weight of 400 pounds or 40 bulk. She must make attack rolls (one per creature or object thrown) to hit the target with the items, using her base attack bonus plus her key ability score modifier as her attack bonus. All objects cause damage ranging from 1 damage per 25 pounds or 2 bulk (for less dangerous objects) to 1d10 damage per 25 pounds or 2 bulk (for extremely dangerous objects, such as weapons or bladed or spiked objects). Objects and creatures that miss the target land in a square adjacent to the target. Creatures that fall within the weight capacity of the spell can be hurled, but they can attempt Will saving throws (or rely on spell resistance) to negate the effect, as can those whose held possessions are targeted by the spell. If a thrown creature is hurled against a solid surface, it takes 1d6 damage as if it had fallen 10 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSOLHQJVYykbKGKKR9_description
attribs.current:
Ylenka gains access to the targets memories and knowledge, and she can pry the information she wants from them involuntarily.

Ylenka can attempt to learn the answer to one question of her choice per round; after each question, the target can attempt a Will saving throw to end the spell. If it fails, the creature can attempt a Bluff check with a DC equal to 47. If it fails its Bluff check, she gains the answer she desires. If it succeeds at its check, she gains no information. If it succeeds by 5 or more, it answers however it chooses and she believes that wrong answer to be the truth. Her questions are purely telepathic inquiries, and the answers to those questions are imparted directly into her mind. She and the target dont need to speak the same language, though less intelligent creatures may yield up only appropriate sensory images in answer to her questions.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSOLHQJVYykbKGKKR9_effect
attribs.current: Target must attempt a Bluff check and on a failure must answer truthfully.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSOLHQJVYykbKGKKR9_save_effect
attribs.current: Target does not answer; if success by 5 or more, it can lie.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSOOwoxdIqdZrsTiZF_description
attribs.current: Ylenka precisely identifies a target, such as by name or via a material connection like a personal possession or lock of its hair. The spell fails without expending a spell slot if the target isnt asleep or in a resting state similar to sleep. If she's never met the target in person and lack a material connection to the target, the target gains a +5 bonus to the saving throw. If the spell works, the target remains resting for 1 minute, then has a nightmare, rouses, and becomes frightened for [[2d6]] rounds. The target cant willingly reenter the affected resting state for 1 hour. To do so after this time has elapsed, the target must succeed at the saving throw again. If this save fails, the target can try again once per hour thereafter. After 24 hours have passed, this restless state ends.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSOOwoxdIqdZrsTiZF_effect
attribs.current: The target remains resting for 1 minute, then has a nightmare, rouses, and becomes frightened for [[2d6]] rounds.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSOSMc3Yi4V3kraZ5w_description
attribs.current:
Like rewriting the code that makes up a computer program, Ylenka manipulate the targets DNA to painfully rewire that targets biological functions to mimic the cold and rigid processes of a robot. The target must succeed at a Will saving throw, or all of its movement speeds are halved and it takes 3d6 slashing damage per round on its turn as its internal organs shift and transform to become more like the inner components of a robot. Each round, the target can attempt a Fortitude saving throw to halve the damage this spell causes.

While this spell is in effect, the targets body becomes visibly more robotic; its voice is tinny and halting, its movements are jerky, and its face is unmoving and emotionless. The target has the flat-footed condition, and it takes a 2 penalty to all Sense Motive checks as well as to all Charisma-based and Dexterity-based skill and ability checks.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSOSMc3Yi4V3kraZ5w_effect
attribs.current: All movements are halved and target takes [[3d6]] slashing damage per round as well as taking -2 penalty to Sense Motive, Charisma-based, and Dexterity-based skill and ability checks.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSOSMc3Yi4V3kraZ5w_save_effect
attribs.current: Will Negates and Fortitude for Half Damage.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSOV2b1zjrvEoCfYif_description
attribs.current:
Ylenka forges a telepathic bond between herself and a number of willing creatures, each of which must have an Intelligence score of 3 or higher (or a modifier of 4 or higher). Each creature included in the link is linked to all the others. The creatures can communicate telepathically through the bond regardless of language. No special power or influence is established as a result of the bond. Once the bond is formed, it works over any distance (although not from one plane to another).

If desired, Ylenka can leave herself out of the telepathic bond forged. This decision must be made at the time of casting.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSOV2b1zjrvEoCfYif_target
attribs.current: Ylenka plus up to six willing creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXSOXUrMov04AoDudET_description
attribs.current:
Ylenka has the ability to see all things within 120 feet as they actually are. She sees through normal and magical darkness, notices secret doors hidden by magic, sees the exact locations of creatures or objects that are invisible or displaced, sees through illusions, and sees the true form of changed or transmuted things. Further, she can focus her vision to see into the Ethereal Plane (but not into extradimensional spaces).

True seeing, however, does not penetrate solid objects. It in no way confers X-ray vision or its equivalent. It does not negate concealment, including that caused by fog and the like. True seeing does not help the Ylenka see through mundane disguises, spot creatures who are simply hiding, or notice secret doors hidden by mundane means.

attribs.current: A plague ooze can fling plague spores, which are bits of disease-ridden matter, with a range increment of 20 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXADHQ2iubHToS6fmZ_effect
attribs.current: Sickened for 1 round; if remains for 2 consecutive rounds, then becomes fatigued.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXXAcQnB3o7Aegv8j4L_description
attribs.current: If a plague ooze is the target of a remove affliction spell, the ooze takes [[7d10]] damage and loses its ooze plague and plague spore abilities for [[1d4+1]] rounds. With a successful Fortitude saving throw, the ooze halves the damage and regains its abilities after only 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXX9gQUJgU6zWWE90sf_description
attribs.current: As a full action, the plague ooze can move up to its speed and through the space of any creatures that are at least one size smaller than itself. It does not need to make an attack roll; each creature whose space it moves through takes damage. A target of a trample can attempt a Reflex save with the listed DC to take half damage; if it attempts the save, it cant make an attack of opportunity against the plague ooze due to the its movement. It can deal trample damage to a given target only once per round.

attribs.current: The AHAV has an extraordinary fly speed of 60 feet (perfect manoeuvrability) and the Spring Attack feat.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MqZI80oQUtGveBkzm6E_description
attribs.current: When the AHAV makes a full attack with its medium machine gun, it can make up to three attacks instead of two attacks. It takes a 5 penalty to these attacks instead of a 4 penalty.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MqZIZbGWigSY9-Vrwv8_description
attribs.current: The AHAV gains a +20 enhancement bonus to Stealth checks.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MqZIj6qRAHSPx5xsqtK_description
attribs.current: The AHAV has numerous pistols or other small arms mounted to its chassis. As a full action, the AHAV automatically succeeds at the harrying fire action against every enemy within 60 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MqZIpb445a1Hxp-qJzi_description
attribs.current: The AHAV gains a slam attack with a +23 attack bonus that deals 6d4+17 bludgeoning damage. If the AHAV hits with this attack after a charge, the target is also knocked back 30 feet. If the target is blocked from moving the full distance, it takes an additional [[1d6]] (1d6) bludgeoning damage per 10 feet it cant move.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MqZJTu89yPBzPrMIION_description
attribs.current: As a full action, an AHAV can gain one of the following benefits for 1 minute: blindsight (life), blindsight (vibration), sense through (vision), or a +10 enhancement bonus to Perception checks. It can change which benefit it receives as a full action. At the GMs discretion, an AHAV might have access to more options, such as blindsight (emotion) or blindsight (thought).

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MqZHALh6YywOoTHUgUk_description
attribs.current: The most basic and portable machine guns are known as squad guns for their popularity among Mercenary groups. Light, Medium, and heavy machine guns remain reliable heavy Weapons for their automatic fire and damage capability.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MqZHEFgV02jlaYrZwJk_description
attribs.current: These portable flamethrowers consist of a heavy rifle-like design with an oversized petrol tank integrated into the weapons stock.

attribs.name: senses
attribs.current: Darkvision (60 ft.), Low-Light Vision, X-Ray Vision

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: 2 LFD Pulse Gauntlets with 4 Batteries (20 Charges each), Corona Artillery Laser with 4 High-Capacity Batteries (40 Charges each)

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MqZLH-dGntkzoVBGNXn_description
attribs.current: When a cybernetic golem takes damage that reduces it to half its maximum Hit Points or fewer, and whenever it takes damage while it has half its maximum Hit Points or fewer, it must attempt a DC 15 Will saving throw. On a failure, the golem goes berserk. While berserk, the golem uses its actions to make a full attack or to move and attack. If it cant reach or shoot a creature, it attacks objects. The golem can attempt a DC 15 Will saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the berserk state. If the golems creator communicates with the golem to calm it, via comm unit or from within 60 feet, and succeeds at a DC 10 Charisma check, the golem receives a +2 circumstance bonus to this saving throw.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MqZLMdi9otbMA56OYYG_description
attribs.current: A golem can receive wireless communications (and thus commands from its creator) at planetary range.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MqZLQd5I2ry9PIsl3Z8_description
attribs.current: A cybernetic golem can use a swift action to gain the benefit of the haste spell. This effect lasts for 1 round, and then the circuit shuts down and must recharge for 1 round before being activated again. The golem can use its circuit up to 10 rounds per day.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MqZLU59GOQwPRnGm7io_description
attribs.current:
A cybernetic or nanotech golem is immune to any spell or spell-like ability that allows spell resistance, unless the spell specifically lists constructs in its Targets entry. In addition, certain spells and effects function differently against the golem as follows.
The golem can be affected by discharge or greater discharge but has a unique reaction to the spells. If the golem fails a saving throw against either spell, it becomes confused for [[1d4]] (1d4) rounds instead of suffering the spells normal effect. The golem can attempt a Fortitude save at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on a success.
Magical effects that deal cold damage slow (as the slow spell) the golem for 3 rounds (no save). If the golem has a haste circuit and it is active, this effect counters the haste circuit but has no other effect.
The golem automatically fails saving throws against weapons and magical effects that deal electricity damage. However, such an effect merely breaks any slow effect on the golem and heals it for 1 Hit Point per 3 damage the effect would have dealt. Any damage that exceeds the golems maximum Hit Points is stored as charges for its weapons, at a rate of 1 charge per Hit Point the golem would have gained. Any additional damage is ignored.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MqZLa6N73bQ8bxkZbMt_description
attribs.current: As a move action, the golem can grant itself X-ray vision, which functions like an X-ray visor.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MqZLCdzdqKQqkZ5ZAYz_description
attribs.current: When a pulse gauntlet strikes its Target, it releases a surge of sonic energy that can knock the Target down. Pulse gauntlets are made of heavy-duty nylon with reinforced pads over the items knuckles.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MqZLCdzdqKQqkZ5ZAZ-_description
attribs.current: Artillery lasers are heavy Weapons designed to be effective against hardened Targets such as Vehicles and enemy bunkers.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MqZLH-dGntkzoVBGNXn_effect
attribs.current: The golem goes berserk; see text.

attribs.current: All-Around Vision, Darkvision (60 ft.), Low-Light Vision

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MqZLMdi9otbMA56OYYG_description
attribs.current: A golem can receive wireless communications (and thus commands from its creator) at planetary range.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MqZLCdzdqKQqkZ5ZAZ-_description
attribs.current: As an attack, a nanotech golem can unleash a stream of nanite particles at a single target as a kinetic attack with a range increment of 90 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MqZOodGz2pPcTqq3IE2_description
attribs.current: A nanotech golem sees in all directions at once.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MqZOrL-GDnC7F3uxvlh_description
attribs.current: Nanites swarm within 5 feet of the nanotech golem, and the golem can enter an opponents space, provoking an attack of opportunity from that foe. At the end of each of the golems turns, each creature within 5 feet of the golem or sharing its space takes 8d6 piercing damage and is nauseated for 1 round. A successful DC 20 Fortitude saving throw halves the damage and negates the condition.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MqZP4abIr5eZk8LBmKJ_description
attribs.current: As an attack, a nanotech golem can unleash a stream of nanite particles at a single target as a kinetic attack with a range increment of 90 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MqZP6IXVgrxgnBDiHvf_description
attribs.current: A nanotech golem is immune to critical hits, as well as entangled, flat-footed, off-kilter, off-target, pinned, prone, and staggered effects. It takes only half damage from any attack or effect that targets only one creature. Automatic fire must hit the golem as if it were three targets to deal full damage to it. In addition, the golem can move through openings 1 inch wide without squeezing, and it can squeeze to move through microscopic openings.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MqZUhU-WTvydrGhzY3T_description
attribs.current: A rebuilt can neither wield weapons nor use items that require an action to activate.

attribs.current: When this nonreflective, dark-grey baton connects with a target, it discharges an electrical pulse that can stagger its victim.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXS2PxoF62J0hFf0d9B_description
attribs.current:
The semiautomatic mechanism of this pistol discharges spent cartridges and reloads fresh ones in the barrel, provided a cartridge remains in the magazine.

Projectile Weapons
Projectile weapons fire solid rounds, such as bullets or rockets. While projectile weapons are relatively antiquated, they provide serviceable firepower at a reasonable price to many travellers and traders.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MXS2VKamAySI9RbfYAW_description
attribs.current:
Shirren-eye rifles are named for their compound sights, which resemble the eyes of the insectile race, but are rarely manufactured by shirren companies. Shirren-eye rifles are extremely accurate and favoured by snipers and sharpshooters.

Projectile Weapons
Projectile weapons fire solid rounds, such as bullets or rockets. While projectile weapons are relatively antiquated, they provide serviceable firepower at a reasonable price to many travellers and traders.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXS2jxYJMeM5RH3ReHy_description
attribs.current:
The mercenary commando detects the surface thoughts of intelligent creatures around them. The amount of information revealed depends on how long you study a particular area or target.

1st Round: The mercenary commando detects the presence or absence of thoughts from conscious creatures that have Intelligence scores of at least 1 (or an Intelligence modifier of 5) or higher.

2nd Round: The mercenary commando detects the number of thinking minds and the Intelligence score (or modifier) of each. If the highest Intelligence score is 26 (or a modifier of +8) or higher and at least 10 points higher than their own Intelligence score (or 5 points higher than their own Intelligence modifier), they are stunned for 1 round and the spell ends. This spell doesnt let them determine the location of the thinking minds if they cant see the creatures whose thoughts they are detecting.

3rd Round: The mercenary commando can read the surface thoughts of any mind in the area. A target who succeeds at its Will save prevents them from reading its thoughts, and they must cast detect thoughts again to have another chance. Creatures of animal intelligence (an Intelligence score of 1 or 2 or an Intelligence modifier of 4 or lower) have simple, instinctual thoughts.

Each round, they can turn to detect thoughts in a new area. The spell can penetrate barriers, but 3 feet of dirt or wood, 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or any force field blocks it.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXS2rWxyVJc8tTdliKU_description
attribs.current: This spell short-circuits the mind of a humanoid creature with a CR of 3 or lower so that it is dazed (unable to take actions, but taking no penalty to AC). Humanoids of CR 4 or higher are not affected. After a creature has been dazed by this spell, it is immune to it for 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXS2rWxyVJc8tTdliKU_target
attribs.current: One Humanoid Creature of CR 3 or Lower

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXS2x8VZM-0v8bQFKTg_description
attribs.current: The mercenary commando points their finger at the target object, gaining the ability to lift it and move it at will from a distance. As a move action, they can propel the object as far as 15 feet in any direction, though the spell ends if the distance between them and the object ever exceeds the spells range. They cant perform complex operations, such as firing a gun or using a computer, but they can shut a mechanical door or lid and work simple buttons to open or close automated doors or trigger an alarm.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXS2x8VZM-0v8bQFKTg_target
attribs.current: One Unattended Object of No More Than 10 lbs. or 1 Bulk

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXS2bNdRg7lmJV-Tcvs_description
attribs.current: When the mercenary commando succeeds at both the skill check and attack roll of their trick attack, they can make the target flat-footed or off-target until the beginning of their next turn. They might learn exploits that grant them additional options for their debilitating trick, but they can select only one option each time they hit with a trick attack.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXS2dhdLbJFYHqF2SK5_description
attribs.current: The mercenary commando can trick or startle a foe and then attack when she drops her guard. As a full action, they can move up to their speed. Whether or not they moved, they can then make an attack with a melee weapon with the operative special property or with any small arm. Just before making their attack, attempt a Bluff, Intimidate, or Stealth check (or a check associated with your specialization; see page 94) with a DC equal to 20 + their targets CR. If they succeed at the check, they deal 5d8 additional damage and the target is flat-footed against their attack. They cant use this ability with a weapon that has the unwieldy special property or that requires a full action to make a single attack.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MXS2ga19DGxjUAGxNDj_description
attribs.current: When making a full attack using only melee weapons with the operative special property or small arms, the mercenary commando can make up to three attacks instead of two.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MqZVkngpwCNAMg1e2pa_description
attribs.current: The first time Asher-34 takes Hit Point damage in a given encounter, for 1 round he can roll attack rolls, saving throws, and skill checks twice and use the better result. He can do so again first time he drops below half his Hit Points in a given encounter.
